sg.chapter_groups.chapter_groups0.title: General
sg.chapter_groups.chapter_groups1.title: GregTech
sg.apotheosis.quests0.description0: A lot of Apotheosis is normally based on exploration. Recipes have been added for most things requiring exploration and mobs. You can have Godforged equipment without ever killing a mob or looting a Chest. You can of course have a mob farm or loot Nether Fortress Chests as well.
sg.apotheosis.quests0.description1: Apotheosis usually requires a large amount of experience for things. You can use the Ender IO Experience Obelisk to store mass amounts of experience for later use. There is also an Enchanted Book called Knowledge of the Ages which converts enemy drops into experience. This scales with things like Looting and also Scavenger, which has a chance to roll a mobs drop table twice.
sg.apotheosis.quests0.subtitle: \"All things that should have been.\"
sg.apotheosis.quests0.tasks0.title: Apotheosis
sg.apotheosis.quests1.description0: Obtained by salvaging a Common affix item or Metal Mixture Dust.
sg.apotheosis.quests1.description1: Used in a Reforging Table to reforge equipment.
sg.apotheosis.quests1.subtitle: Common!
sg.apotheosis.quests2.description0: Obtained by salvaging an Uncommon affix item, or made in an MV Chemical Reactor.
sg.apotheosis.quests2.description1: Used in a Reforging Table to reforge equipment.
sg.apotheosis.quests2.subtitle: Uncommon!
sg.apotheosis.quests3.description0: Obtained by salvaging a Rare affix item, or made in an HV Chemical Reactor.
sg.apotheosis.quests3.description1: Used in a Reforging Table to reforge equipment.
sg.apotheosis.quests3.subtitle: Rare!
sg.apotheosis.quests4.description0: Obtained by salvaging an Epic affix item, or made in an EV Chemical Reactor.
sg.apotheosis.quests4.description1: Used in a Reforging Table to reforge equipment.
sg.apotheosis.quests4.subtitle: Epic!
sg.apotheosis.quests5.description0: Obtained by salvaging a Mythic affix item, or made in an IV Autoclave.
sg.apotheosis.quests5.description1: Used in a Reforging Table to reforge equipment.
sg.apotheosis.quests5.subtitle: Mythic!
sg.apotheosis.quests6.description0: There are 3 options for obtaining Gem Dust. You can use the normal way of dropping an Anvil on some Apotheosis Gems, once you have some you can craft a Salvaging Table which can also break down Gems into Gem Dust. You can also craft Gem Dust in an HV Mixer with some rather basic materials.
sg.apotheosis.quests6.subtitle: Craftable!
sg.apotheosis.quests7.description0: Use in a Smithing Table to unsocket Gems from an item.
sg.apotheosis.quests7.description1: The Gems will be destroyed in the process.
sg.apotheosis.quests7.subtitle: Keep the item!
sg.apotheosis.quests8.description0: Use in a Smithing Table to unsocket Gems from an item.
sg.apotheosis.quests8.description1: The item will be destroyed in the process.
sg.apotheosis.quests8.subtitle: Keep the Gems!
sg.apotheosis.quests9.description0: Use in a Smithing Table to remove the affix names from an item.
sg.apotheosis.quests9.subtitle: Remove the names!
sg.apotheosis.quests10.description0: Apotheosis adds the ability to upgrade Spawners by using certain items on a Spawner. Most of the items required are GregTech related, see the uses for a Spawner in REI to see the modification items.
sg.apotheosis.quests10.description1: Apotheosis also adds the ability to harvest Spawners using Silk Touch, however this does cause quite a bit of durability damage to the tool.
sg.apotheosis.quests10.description2: Spawners are craftable and Spawn Eggs are purchasable from the Market block. You can use a Spawn Egg on a Spawner to set the Spawner to that mob type.
sg.apotheosis.quests10.subtitle: Upgrade Spawners!
sg.apotheosis.quests10.tasks0.title: Spawners
sg.apotheosis.quests11.description0: Apootheosis greatly extends enchanting by increasing the maximum levels of enchantments. Enchanting Tables can now exceed level 30 enchantmnets by using certain Bookshelves from Apotheosis. You can see in the tooltip of an item which stats it will increase. If you max out Eterna you will be able to spent 100 levels on enchantments.
sg.apotheosis.quests11.subtitle: Level 100 enchantments!
sg.apotheosis.quests11.tasks0.title: Enchanting
sg.apotheosis.quests12.description0: Apotheosis adds the ability to add/remove affixes to/from items.
sg.apotheosis.quests12.description1: If you obtain an affix item, you can break it down into Rarity Materials. These Rarity Materials can be used to place affixes on your equipment.
sg.apotheosis.quests12.description2: There are also Gems. Gems can be socketed into equipment if the equipment has an available socket space. This can be done in the Smithing Table.
sg.apotheosis.quests12.description3: All Gems are craftable in the lowest tier they come in.
sg.apotheosis.quests12.description4: More information on these processes can be found below.
sg.apotheosis.quests12.subtitle: Affixes!
sg.apotheosis.quests12.tasks0.title: Equipment
sg.apotheosis.quests13.description0: Allows you to either add affixes to equipment or reroll the affixes that is already on a piece of equipment using experience, Gem Dust and Rarity Materials.
sg.apotheosis.quests13.description1: No choices will be shown until you place a Rarity Material as that will determine which rarity the affix will be.
sg.apotheosis.quests13.description2: The Simple Reforging Table has a maximum rarity of Rare, if you want higher tier rarities you need the Reforging Table.
sg.apotheosis.quests13.subtitle: A lot of experience!
sg.apotheosis.quests14.description0: Works the same as the Simple Reforging Table but allows up to Mythic rarity.
sg.apotheosis.quests14.subtitle: Even more experience!
sg.apotheosis.quests15.description0: Insert unwanted affix items and you can break them down into Rarity Material of the same rarity.
sg.apotheosis.quests15.description1: &6The item will be destroyed in the process.&r
sg.apotheosis.quests15.description2: Note you can also craft all of the Rarity Materials.
sg.apotheosis.quests15.subtitle: Unwanted affix items!
sg.apotheosis.quests16.description0: Uses Gem Dust and Rarity Materials to upgrade Gems. All gems have multiple tiers, ranging from Chipped to Perfect.
sg.apotheosis.quests16.description1: You require 2 of the previous tier Gem to upgrade to the next tier Gem, as well as some Rarity Materials and Gem Dust.
sg.apotheosis.quests16.subtitle: Upgrade Gems!
sg.apotheosis.quests17.description0: Can be used to add a Socket to an item in a Smithing Table.
sg.apotheosis.quests17.description1: The standard Sigil of Socketing can add 1 Socket up to a maximum of 3.
sg.apotheosis.quests17.description2: The upgraded Superior Sigil of Socketing can add 1 Socket up to a maximum of 4.
sg.apotheosis.quests17.subtitle: Add Sockets!
sg.apotheosis.title: Apotheosis
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests0.descript: You have an ME Crafting Terminal ready to use.
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests0.subtitle: You don't need to pick it up!
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests1.descript: You have a fully loaded ME Drive with 8 64k ME Item Storage Cells and 2 64k ME Fluid Storage Cells.
Under the ME Drive is a Creative Energy Cell.
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests1.subtitle: You don't need to pick it up!
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests2.descript: Insert Blank Patterns into the slot and encode crafting recipes into Blank Patterns for the Pattern Provider to use.
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests2.subtitle: Encoding Blank Patterns!
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests3.descript: Provides Patterns to blocks that can craft with them. Face a Molecular Assembler to allow the Patterns for basic Crafting. Face a machine to allow processing Patterns.
Basic autocrafting just requires 1 of these containing a Pattern (up to 9) facing the block you want to craft with.

To register an autocraft as complete, the system needs to have the crafted items inserted back into the system, this block will work for that as anything inserted into it will be inserted back into the system.
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests3.subtitle: Holds Patterns!
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests4.descript: Performs simple crafting recipes. Requires a Pattern Provider with Crafting Patterns inside.
When you request a craft this is the block that will actually craft items.
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests4.subtitle: Super crafter!
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests5.descript: Used to create Printed Circuits and Processors, which are used for almost everything throughout AE2.
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests5.subtitle: The start!
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests6.descript: Can be used to import or export item or fluids.
Set a filter above a slot to export that item or fluid from the network into the ME Interface.
Insert an item or fluid into a slot with no filter to insert into the network.
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests6.subtitle: Import/export!
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests7.descript: The larger the Crafting Storage you have, the larger the recipes you can autocraft.
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests7.subtitle: Make the largest you can!
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests7.title: Crafting Storage
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests8.descript: Charges item with AE power, can charge a Certus Quartz Crystal into a Charged Certus Quartz Crystal.
Note this cannot charge GregTech items with EU, GregTech has charging methods for that. Certain items requiring FE can be charged, but others may require a Charging Station.
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests8.subtitle: Charging things!
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests9.descript: Used in some recipes and used to craft Fluix Crystals.
To obtain Certus Quartz Crystals from AE2 place a Certus Quartz from GregTech in an Autoclave with some Water.
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests9.subtitle: Only AE2 version will charge!
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests10.descrip: Crafted by tossing Charged Certus Quartz Crystals, Redstone Dust, and Nether Quartz into Water or a Mixer containing Water.
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests11.descrip: As you can see you have a functioning AE2 ststem with storage. There is a Creative Energy Cell under it all powering it. Your entire AE2 system will be free to use.
&nChannels are infinite.&r You are not limited by channels due to the mass amount of machines to deal with in GregTech.
No recipes have been changed for AE2 allowing a very easy start into the modpack. There has only been helper recipes added to help automate things.
Not even close to everything will be included in this chapter, just the basics for getting a starter autocrafting setup.
&6With almost every item from AE2 you can hover your mouse over it and hold [G] to open an in game guide.&r
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests11.title: Applied Energistics 2
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests13.descrip: Can produce 4 Charged Certus Quartz Crystals at a time very quickly.
The base time is 1 second but this can be cut in half by providing Nitrogen Gas.
Accepts both AE2 and GregTech Certus Quartz.
The items listed are the minimum requirements without Hatches or Busses.
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests15.descrip: Cable Facades can be placed on AE2 Cables to hide the cable and make it look like another block.
The recipes are hidden in EMI because there are so many of them. Simply craft 4 Cable Anchors around any block in a crafting grid and you will craft 4 Cable Facades of that block type.
Note that GregTech also has Facades, they are used for GregTech Cables only.
sg.applied_energistcs_2.quests15.title: Cable Facade
sg.applied_energistcs_2.title: Applied Energistcs 2

sg.energy_generation.quests14.descriptio: Batteries can be placed inside a Battery Buffer or directly into machines as an energy storage method. If a Battery Buffer or machine that contains a Battery receives energy the Battery will charge. If a machine needs energy and either the machine itself or a Battery Buffer contains a battery with energy, the Battery will send the energy to the machine. You must use the proper tier of Battery.
You may also use Batteries to charge handheld items that require EU by sneak right clicking while holding a Battery which will enable or disable the discharge mode.
There are often a few types of Batteries per voltage tier that hold different amounts of energy.
sg.energy_generation.quests14.subtitle: Energy storage!

sg.energy_generation.quests23.descriptio: The Power Substation is an expandable multiblock designed to hold mass amounts of energy. The output rate depends on the Dynamo Hatch you use. Can support multiple different Dynamo Hatches to supply different energy ratings at the same time.
The multiblock can be expanded to having 18 layers of Capacitors. The Capacitors do not have to be the same tier.
Has a passive drain of 1%% of the total capacity every 24 hours.

sg.energy_generation.quests52.descriptio: GregTech uses a special energy system called EU that generally does not interact with FE. They can be converted between each other at a 1:4 ratio though. 1 EU = 4 FE.

GregTech also uses something called Amperage, or amps for short. An amp is basically a channel for an electrical current. You cannot just add 4 LV Steam Turbines together that are producing 32 EU/t to reach 128 EU/t. Instead you will end up with 4 amps of 32 EU/t. Wires/Cables and machines also have an amp rating. Single Block machines are usually only able to accept 1 amp of energy. Supplying too much EU/t or amps to a Wire/Cable will make them burn up and supplying too much EU/t to a machine will casuse the machine to explode.
It is very important to know how much energy you are sending to have the proper sized cables and proper tier of machines.

FE works completely differently, if you had 4 generators all producing 60 FE/t, you would end up just adding the numbers together and you would be producing 240 FE/t. There are no amps or electrical channels when it comes to FE.

You can convert between the 2 using an Energy Converter, be sure to match the tier of the EU you require with the right tier Energy Converter as there is one for each voltage tier. Check the tooltip of the Energy Converter to see the conversion rates and tiers.

You can stay completely with EU and use only GregTech if you wish, or you could convert FE generated using Advanced Genertors, however this would not be available until the IV age. If you wish to transfer your energy as FE you could generate EU, convert it to FE, transfer the FE wirelessly using a few methods like a Tesseract, then convert back to EU where you require it. This makes it so you could make a central bank of energy as FE and wirelessly transmit it where you need EU and convert it on site.
sg.energy_generation.quests52.title: EU/RF
sg.energy_generation.quests53.descriptio: Burns liquids and gasses to generate FE. All fuels from the Gas Turbines and Combustion Generators have been added.
sg.energy_generation.quests53.subtitle: Liquids/Gasses - FE!
sg.energy_generation.quests54.descriptio: Burns Steam to generate FE. Steam from GregTech or Advanced Generators is acceptable.
sg.energy_generation.quests54.subtitle: Steam - FE!
sg.energy_generation.quests55.descriptio: Burns Carbon to generate Syngas, which can be burned in a Gas Turbine Controller
sg.energy_generation.quests55.subtitle: Carbon - Syngas!
sg.energy_generation.quests56.descriptio: Available in the IV age, Advanced Generators offers flexible multiblock FE generators. The multiblocks are completely flexible as any block can go anywhere as long as they are all touching each other.
See the tooltips of the different controllers to see what blocks can be installed in the multiblock and how many of each block.
See the uses for the Controller blocks in EMI to see their fuels and energy generation rates.
sg.energy_generation.quests56.subtitle: Generate FE!
sg.energy_generation.title: Energy Generation
sg.evage.quests0.description0: While you can basically jump right into making new Circuits, this is where your automations will be tested. If you are not automating at least most of your Circuits by now, that should be a priority.
sg.evage.quests0.subtitle: IV Circuits!
sg.evage.quests1.description0: Just as Titanium was the main material for the EV age, Tungstensteel is the main material for the IV age.
sg.evage.quests1.subtitle: IV material!
sg.evage.quests2.description0: Process in an EV EBF with Nichrome Coils to produce Hot Tungstensteel Ingtots.
sg.evage.quests2.subtitle: EV EBF!
sg.evage.quests3.description0: Process Tungsten Dust and Steel Dust in an EV Mixer to produce Tungstensteel Dust.
sg.evage.quests3.subtitle: EV Mixer!
sg.evage.quests4.description0: Process either Tungstate Dust or Scheelite Dust in an EV Chemical Bath with Hydrocloric Acid to produce Tungstic Acid Dust.
sg.evage.quests4.description1: Process in an EV Electrolyzer to produce Tungsten Dust.
sg.evage.quests4.subtitle: EV Electrolyzer!
sg.evage.quests5.description0: Used in EV multiblock generators to generate EV energy.
sg.evage.quests5.subtitle: Multiblock energy!
sg.evage.quests6.description0: You are going to want at least a small stock of these as they take 10 minutes to cook in the EBF with an HV energy rating and Kanthal Coils.
sg.evage.quests6.subtitle: 10 minutes.
sg.evage.quests7.description0: Requires an HV Cutter in a Cleanroom.
sg.evage.quests7.description1: Provides 4 Wafers instead of 1 in the Laser Engraver.
sg.evage.quests7.subtitle: HV Cleanroom!
sg.evage.quests8.description0: Requires an HV Laser Engraver in a Cleanroom.
sg.evage.quests8.description1: Some of these will be required to upgrade into HPIC Wafers in the IV age.
sg.evage.quests8.subtitle: HV Cleanroom!
sg.evage.quests9.description0: You must know how these work by now.
sg.evage.quests9.subtitle: Buy Cocoa Beans at the Market block!
sg.evage.quests10.subtitle: EV Cutter!
sg.evage.quests11.description0: Mix with Methane Gas in a Chemical Reactor to produce Chloroform.
sg.evage.quests11.subtitle: Chlorine + Methane!
sg.evage.quests12.description0: Mix with Chlorine Gas in a Chemical Reactor to produce Chloroform.
sg.evage.quests12.subtitle: Methane + Chlorine!
sg.evage.quests13.description0: Mix with Hydrogen Gas in a Chemical Reactor to produce Hydrofluoric Acid.
sg.evage.quests13.subtitle: Fluorine + Hydrogen!
sg.evage.quests14.description0: Mix with Chloroform in a Chemical Reactor to produce Tetrafluoroethylene.
sg.evage.quests14.subtitle: Hydrofluoric Acid + Chloroform!
sg.evage.quests15.description0: Mix with Hydrofluoric Acid in a Chemical Reactor to produce Tetrafluoroethylene.
sg.evage.quests15.subtitle: Chloroform + Hydrofluoric Acid!
sg.evage.quests16.description0: Mix with either Oxygen Gas or Air in a Chemical Reactor to produce liquid Polytetrafluoroethylene.
sg.evage.quests16.subtitle: Just add the Poly!
sg.evage.quests17.description0: This is basically your new Polyethylene, with that being said, you are going to want this entire process automated.
sg.evage.quests17.description1: Required for quite a few things moving forward, like IV Machine Hulls, EV Batteries, and much more.
sg.evage.quests17.subtitle: \"Liquid Gotohell Bucket.\"
sg.evage.quests18.description0: EV Batteries, which can store 4 minutes of EV energy each.
sg.evage.quests18.subtitle: 4 minutes!
sg.evage.quests19.description0: Used to craft EV related energy items.
sg.evage.quests19.subtitle: EV Assembler!
sg.evage.quests20.description0: Radon has 2 ways to obtain (for now), you can either go the Ender Air route in an IV Distillation Tower, or the Plutionium, Uranium, Air route in an HV Large Chemical Reactor. Look through REI and see what makes more sense to you.
sg.evage.quests20.subtitle: Choices!
sg.evage.quests21.description0: Process Eyes of Ender and Radon Gas in an HV Chemical Bath to produce Quantum Eyes.
sg.evage.quests21.subtitle: Ender Eye + Radon Gas!
sg.evage.quests22.description0: Used to craft the EV Circuit Assembler and the EV Laser Engraver.
sg.evage.quests22.subtitle: EV Circuit Assembler!
sg.evage.quests23.description0: The whole Circuit line requires an EV Cleanroom.
sg.evage.quests23.subtitle: This is the third HV Circuit!
sg.evage.quests24.description0: Process Nano CPU Wafers in an HV Cutter to produce Nano CPU Chips.
sg.evage.quests24.subtitle: HV Cutter!
sg.evage.quests25.description0: Process Epoxy Circuit Boards, Electrum foil and either Sodium Persulfate or Iron Iii Chloride in an LV Chemical Reactor to produce Epoxy Printed Circuit Boards.
sg.evage.quests25.subtitle: Epoxy Circuit Board + Electrum Foil + Sodium Persulfate/Iron Iii Chloride!
sg.evage.quests26.description0: Process Epoxy Sheets, Gold Foil, and Sulfuric Acid in an LV Chemical Reactor to produce Epoxy Circuit Boards.
sg.evage.quests26.subtitle: Epoxy Sheet + Gold Foil + Sulfuric Acid!
sg.evage.quests27.description0: Process Liquid Epoxy in a ULV Fluid Solidifier to produce Epoxy Sheets.
sg.evage.quests27.subtitle: ULV Fluid Solidifer!
sg.evage.quests28.description0: Process CPU Wafers, Raw Carbon Fibers, and Liquid Glowstone in an EV Chemical Reactor in a Cleanroom to produce Nano CPU Wafers.
sg.evage.quests28.subtitle: CPU Wafers + Raw Carbon Fibers + Liquid Glowstone!
sg.evage.quests29.description0: Process Salt Water in an LV Electrolyzer to produce Sodium Hydroxide Dust.
sg.evage.quests29.subtitle: LV Electrolyzer!
sg.evage.quests31.description0: There are a few option to produce Epichlorohydrin. Look through REI to see what suits you best.
sg.evage.quests31.subtitle: Choices!
sg.evage.quests34.description0: There are a few option to produce Hydrochloric Acid. Look through REI to see what suits you best.
sg.evage.quests34.description1: Hydrochloric Acid is used a lot in many different chemical mixtures.
sg.evage.quests34.subtitle: Choices!
sg.evage.quests36.subtitle: This is the second EV Circuit!
sg.evage.quests38.subtitle: This is the second IV Circuit!
sg.evage.quests39.description0: Works the same as the basic single block ore generators, but generates a stack at a time.
sg.evage.quests39.subtitle: Upgrading your ore generation!
sg.evage.quests40.description0: Has a loss of 0 EU per block.
sg.evage.quests40.subtitle: EV superconductor!
sg.evage.quests41.description0: Process Nitric Acid and Hydrochloric Acid in an LV Mixer to produce Aqua Regia.
sg.evage.quests41.subtitle: Nitric Acid + Hydrochloric Acid!
sg.evage.quests42.description0: Process Platinum Group Sludge and Aqua Regia in an HV Centrifuge to produce Inert Metal Mixture.
sg.evage.quests42.subtitle: Platinum Group Sludge + Aqua Regia!
sg.evage.quests43.description0: There are a few option to produce Nitric Acid. Look through EMI to see what suits you best.
sg.evage.quests43.subtitle: Choices!
sg.evage.quests44.description0: Process \"Platinum Group\" Purified Ores and Nitric Acid in an LV Chemical Reactor to produce Platinum Group Sludge.
sg.evage.quests44.subtitle: \"Platinum Group\" Purified Ores + Nitric Acid!
sg.evage.quests47.subtitle: EV Assembler!
sg.evage.quests47.title: RTM Alloy Coils
sg.evage.quests48.description0: Process Vanadium dust, Steel Dust, and Chormium Dust in an MV Mixer to Produce Vanadium Steel Dust.
sg.evage.quests48.subtitle: Vanadium Dust + Steel Dust + Chromium Dust!
sg.evage.title: EV Age
sg.hidden_test.quests0.description0: A condensed progression view, contianing just the benchmarks of each voltage age.
sg.hidden_test.quests0.subtitle: An alternate view!
sg.hidden_test.title: Streamlined Progression
sg.hv_age.quests0.description0: I think you understand how Circuits work by now.
sg.hv_age.quests0.subtitle: EV Circuits!
sg.hv_age.quests1.description0: The second HV Circuit, can be used in place of the original HV Circuits.
sg.hv_age.quests1.subtitle: This is the second HV Circuit!
sg.hv_age.quests2.description0: The third MV Circuit, can be used in place of the original MV Circuits.
sg.hv_age.quests2.subtitle: This is the third MV Circuit!
sg.hv_age.quests3.description0: A new Circuit Board type, used in quite a few Circuit types.
sg.hv_age.quests3.subtitle: A new Circuit board!
sg.hv_age.quests4.description0: While Polyethylene Sheets can be used, Polyvinyl Chloride Sheets will produce twice as much. Look into getting a Liquid Polyvinyl Chloride production setup. For now it is completely optional but can help preserve Polyethylene.
sg.hv_age.quests4.description1: If you have more Polyethylene than you can handle, there is no need for Polyvinyl Chloride for now, but it is highly recommended as you will require the Polyvinyl Chloride later on.
sg.hv_age.quests4.subtitle: Choices!
sg.hv_age.quests5.description0: There are 2 types of Inductors, both are valid for Circuits, both are obtainable. If you can craft the SMD Inductors then you probably should as you can craft 32 at a time.
sg.hv_age.quests5.subtitle: Choices!
sg.hv_age.quests5.tasks0.title: Inductors
sg.hv_age.quests5.title: Inductors
sg.hv_age.quests6.description0: Place machines inside the Cleanroom multiblock to perform Cleanroom recipes. Note that other blocks can be placed inside as well, like Quantum Rings, Travel Anchors, and Elevators.
sg.hv_age.quests6.description1: Can be a minimum of 5x5x5 and maximum of 15x15x15. You will require many machines inside a Cleanroom eventually, and even some multiblocks.
sg.hv_age.quests6.description2: Additional blocks that are not listed, Diode, Busses/Hatches, Passthrough Hatches, Machine Hull.
sg.hv_age.quests6.description3: As per normal routine most of the Busses/Hatches are flexible.
sg.hv_age.quests6.description4: This multiblock requires a Machine Hull to provide energy to machines inside the Cleanroom. Power the Machine Hull from the outside and access the energy from the inside. If it is not working, spin it around. The red side should face inside the Cleanroom.
sg.hv_age.quests6.description5: Note the multiblock will form with an LV Energy Hatch but it will not start the cleaning process unless it is at least an MV Energy Hatch.
sg.hv_age.quests6.description6: Passthrough Hatches allow items or fluids to be \"passed through\" the walls of the multiblock, allowing transfer through the walls.
sg.hv_age.quests6.description7: Interact with the Cleanroom block in the top center from either inside or outside to see the status of the Cleanroom. The status must be CLEAN in order for recipes to work.
sg.hv_age.quests6.description8: Tip: You can get infinite Concrete from the Infinite Block Generator.
sg.hv_age.quests6.description9: The items listed are the minimum requirements without Hatches or Busses.
sg.hv_age.quests6.subtitle: Place machines inside!
sg.hv_age.quests7.description0: An advanced multiblock version of the Distillery, capable of obtaining more fluid outputs.
sg.hv_age.quests7.description1: The size of the multiblock can vary depending on the amount of outputs you are getting. If you are only getting 2 outputs, it only needs to be as tall as 2 Output Hatches, if you are getting 4 outputs, it needs to be as tall as 4 Output Hatches.
sg.hv_age.quests7.description2: Every level higher must contain 1 Output Hatch and the bottom level cannot contain an Output Hatch.
sg.hv_age.quests7.description3: The items listed are the minimum requirements without Hatches or Busses.
sg.hv_age.quests7.subtitle: A multiblock Distillery!
sg.hv_age.quests8.description0: SMD components basically replace your original Circuit components, being significantly easier to craft in larger amounts.
sg.hv_age.quests8.subtitle: Circuits made easier!
sg.hv_age.quests8.title: SMD Components
sg.hv_age.quests9.subtitle: HV recipes!
sg.hv_age.quests10.description0: Required to cut LPIC Wafers into LPIC Chips.
sg.hv_age.quests10.subtitle: HV recipes!
sg.hv_age.quests11.description0: That's enough alloys for now, make some Blue Steel Plates and maybe some hand tools depending how much you crafted as they have a durability of 1024.
sg.hv_age.quests11.subtitle: Durable tools!
sg.hv_age.quests12.description0: Used for crafting HV energy related blocks, like the HV Energy Hatch.
sg.hv_age.quests12.subtitle: Finally!
sg.hv_age.quests13.subtitle: Only 1 option this time!
sg.hv_age.quests14.description0: Required to craft different colored Glass Lenses.
sg.hv_age.quests14.subtitle: HV recipes!
sg.hv_age.quests15.description0: Cut into LPIC Chips in an HV Cutter.
sg.hv_age.quests15.subtitle: Cut me!
sg.hv_age.quests16.description0: Mostly used to craft an Advanced Cutter II as you need a Blue Steel Buzzsaw Blade.
sg.hv_age.quests16.description1: Process in an EBF to obtain Blue Steel Ingots.
sg.hv_age.quests16.subtitle: Dust #3!
sg.hv_age.quests17.description0: Required to craft Black Steel Dust.
sg.hv_age.quests17.description1: Do not process into Black Bronze Ingots!
sg.hv_age.quests17.subtitle: Dust #1!
sg.hv_age.quests18.description0: While it is mostly used to craft Blue Steel Dust, you will need some Fine Black Steel Wires to craft High Voltage Coils as well.
sg.hv_age.quests18.subtitle: Dust #2!
sg.hv_age.quests19.description0: An HV Energy Hatch requires a bit of work.
sg.hv_age.quests19.description1: Upgrade your EBF to have an HV Energy Hatch since you will need 2 in order to process EV recipes as well.
sg.hv_age.quests19.description2: Note that Steam is not going to hold up to the HV age very well, you should have or may want to look into another liquid fuel source, such as Diesel or LPG, there are quite a few options.
sg.hv_age.quests19.subtitle: Upgrade the EBF!
sg.hv_age.quests20.description0: A simple 1:1 mixture of Sodium Dust and Potassium Dust in a Chemical Reactor, both of which come from various sources in an Electrolyzer.
sg.hv_age.quests20.description1: Salt Dust and Rock Salt Dust are the easier ways as they both come from ores and they are a 2:1 ratio. You will also be left with some Chlorine which can be useful down the road for making Titanium Tetrachloride.
sg.hv_age.quests20.subtitle: Exactly what it sounds like!
sg.hv_age.quests21.description0: Just as Stainless Steel was the main material for the HV age, Titanium is the main material for the EV age.
sg.hv_age.quests21.description1: Note the byproduct of Magnesium Chloride Dust, you can process it in an Electrolyzer to get all of your Magnesium Dust and Chlorine back.
sg.hv_age.quests21.subtitle: EV material!
sg.hv_age.quests22.description0: Some Hot Ingots must be cooled down in a Vacuum Freezer.
sg.hv_age.quests22.description1: Surely you know how multiblocks work by now.
sg.hv_age.quests22.description2: The items listed are the minimum requirements without Hatches or Busses.
sg.hv_age.quests22.subtitle: Super cooling!
sg.hv_age.quests23.description0: Magnesium Dust can come from a variety of things but also Magnesite Ore.
sg.hv_age.quests23.subtitle: Liquid Titanium!
sg.hv_age.quests24.subtitle: HV recipes!
sg.hv_age.quests25.description0: There are a few ways to obtain Rutile Dust so I will leave that up to you.
sg.hv_age.quests25.description1: Advised to set up a Simple Ore Generator for Bauxite Ore and run it through a processing chain for unlimited Rutile Dust.
sg.hv_age.quests25.subtitle: Choices!
sg.hv_age.quests26.description0: Well it's day 373 and I still havn't left the Overworld, I havn't made any armor or weapons. The only things I've killed are Phantoms and that pesky Wandering Trader with his Llamas... I have 26 Leads...
sg.hv_age.quests26.subtitle: Day 373...
sg.hv_age.quests26.tasks0.title: Captain's Log
sg.hv_age.quests27.description0: Used to further process fuel types. Follow the EMI chains.
sg.hv_age.quests27.description1: The items listed are the minimum requirements without Hatches or Busses.
sg.hv_age.quests27.subtitle: Fuel processing!
sg.hv_age.quests28.description0: Used to craft HV Energy Hatches and HV Dynamo Hatches.
sg.hv_age.quests28.subtitle: HV multiblocks!
sg.hv_age.quests29.description0: Allows you to craft higher tier Circuits. The entire new Circuit line will require MV Circuit Assemblers.
sg.hv_age.quests29.subtitle: New Circuit line!
sg.hv_age.quests30.description0: You can either go the Laser Engraver route or the Sifter route, both viable options.
sg.hv_age.quests30.description1: You will need Flawless Emeralds for MV Emitters and MV Sensors.
sg.hv_age.quests30.subtitle: Choices!
sg.hv_age.quests31.subtitle: HV Assembler!
sg.hv_age.quests31.title: Nichrome Coils
sg.hv_age.quests32.description0: Process Nickel Dust and Chromium Dust in an MV Mixer to produce Nichrome Dust.
sg.hv_age.quests32.description1: Process in an HV EBF to produce Hot Nichrome Ingots.
sg.hv_age.quests32.subtitle: MV Mixer!
sg.hv_age.quests33.description0: Mostly used to make Coils but it has some other uses.
sg.hv_age.quests33.subtitle: New Coils!
sg.hv_age.quests34.description0: Has a loss of 0 EU per block.
sg.hv_age.quests34.subtitle: HV superconductor!
sg.hv_age.title: HV Age
sg.intro.quests0.description0: The idea of this pack is to get right into GregTech ASAP while making resource generation as easy as possible, GregTech with unlimited resources.
sg.intro.quests0.description1: Your starter island and inventory has everything you need to jump right into everything.
sg.intro.quests0.description2: Grab your Netherite Hammer and get to work! You even have an ME Crafting Terminal with a full ME Drive and a Creative Energy Cell!
sg.intro.quests0.description3: Almost all \"hard mode\" recipes have been enabled in the config file, but other than that no GregTech recipes have been altered. Some other mods have been changed slightly to fit more GregTech recipe styles and fit the modpack better.
sg.intro.quests0.description4: With GregTechCEu Modern still being rather new to 1.20.1 there are some bugs to be expected, I am doing my best to work around them.
sg.intro.quests0.description5: Note that The Nether and The End dimensions are also void worlds but do still spawn structures and the Ender Dragon, although you may never find a need to go to either dimension.
sg.intro.quests0.subtitle: Go go GregTech!
sg.intro.quests1.description1: Mine the ore to generate another random ore.
sg.intro.quests1.description2: Once you get a raw ore you want a lot of, toss it in the Raw Conversion Generator to produce unlimited amounts of that ore.
sg.intro.quests1.description3: Keep in mind that with REI inventory highlighting on (or in AE2 terminals) you can search for items by their element name, like Cu for Copper.
sg.intro.quests1.description4: You already have one of these on your platform. You need to pick it up and place it down to reset it for it to start working.
sg.intro.quests1.subtitle: Unlimited random raw ores!
sg.intro.quests2.description0: Insert a raw ore of any kind in the GUI and the corresponding ore will be generated above it the Raw Conversion Generator.
sg.intro.quests2.description1: The raw ore is &nnot consumed&r while generating ores.
sg.intro.quests2.description2: You already have one of these on your platform. You need to pick it up and place it down to reset it for it to start working.
sg.intro.quests2.description3: Try to remember to always keep at least 1 raw ore stored away.
sg.intro.quests2.subtitle: Raw ore not consumed!
sg.intro.quests3.description0: Does not actually hold Water but can fill Buckets and convert some items.
sg.intro.quests3.description1: A lot of Clay is going to be needed at the start.
sg.intro.quests3.description6: You already have one of these on your platform.
sg.intro.quests3.description7: There are other blocks to help with Water generation later on.
sg.intro.quests3.subtitle: Easy Clay!
sg.intro.quests3.tasks0.title: Primitive Water Condenser
sg.intro.quests4.description0: Instead of placing an ore block in the world, this block will generate an ore in its 1 slot of inventory. You will need a way to extract the items, like a Hopper or Item Pipes.
sg.intro.quests4.subtitle: Automated!
sg.intro.quests5.description0: Place under an ore block to generate that ore block as an item.
sg.intro.quests5.description1: Instead of placing an ore block in the world, this block will generate an ore in its 1 slot of inventory. You will need a way to extract the items, like a Hopper or Item Pipes.
sg.intro.quests5.description2: You should really be getting in the habbit of having 1 of these feeding into a factory line for complete automation.
sg.intro.quests5.subtitle: Automated!
sg.intro.quests6.description0: Crushing Hammers are used to crush Stone/Cobblestone into Gravel, Gravel into Sand, Sand into Dust, and Dirt into saplings and Plant Fiber.
sg.intro.quests6.description1: Harvest blocks in world to convert them.
sg.intro.quests6.description2: FTB Ultimine works for large groups at once.
sg.intro.quests6.description3: They are also a multi tool, harvesting things that a pickaxe, shovel, and axe would.
sg.intro.quests6.description4: GregTech Hammers also process blocks they harvest in the world as they would be in a Forge Hammer, allowing them to obtain Gravel, Sand, and Dust as well.
sg.intro.quests6.subtitle: Crushes, mines, digs, and chops!
sg.intro.quests6.title: Crushing Hammers
sg.intro.quests7.description0: Does not actually hold Lava but can fill Buckets.
sg.intro.quests7.description1: You already have one of these on your platform.
sg.intro.quests7.description2: There are other blocks to help with Lava generation later on.
sg.intro.quests7.subtitle: Lava Buckets!
sg.intro.quests7.tasks0.title: Primitive Lava Condenser
sg.intro.quests8.description0: Passive mobs can spawn on Grass Blocks with enough light while you are far enough away.
sg.intro.quests8.description1: You may also craft a Golden Egg which can be used to create Delightful Dirt, which spawns passive mobs frequently as long as the biome allows it.
sg.intro.quests8.description2: The Market block also sells (almost) every Spawn Egg, and Spawners are craftable. You can use a Spawn Egg to set a Spawner to that mob type.
sg.intro.quests8.subtitle: Where are all my Chickens?
sg.intro.quests8.tasks0.title: Passive Mobs
sg.intro.quests9.description0: This modpack is meant to skip all of the early grind that in normally in skyblocks.
sg.intro.quests9.description1: That being said, you start with infinite ore generators with a unique twist.
sg.intro.quests9.description2: On the left is the Random Ore Generator which will constantly generate a random ore block above it if there is room, mine the block away and have another random ore generate. This may feel chaotic and too random at first, but once you get a material you want more of, place it in the block on the right, the Raw Conversion Generator.
sg.intro.quests9.description3: The Raw Conversion Generator will accept 1 raw ore of any kind and generate an ore block of that type above it if there is room. &nThe raw ore is not consumed.&r
sg.intro.quests9.description4: &6Note you have to pick them up and place them down again for them to work, they are just set up as a display.&r
sg.intro.quests9.description5: Being very cheap the idea is to have one set up for each material you need, later having automatic options or just using a Block Breaker.
sg.intro.quests9.description6: You have access to every raw ore in the modpack and the ability to generate infinite amounts of whichever ore you want.
sg.intro.quests9.description7: Ore processing is less important than normal modpacks for obvious reasons, however some materials are only obtainable as a byproduct.
sg.intro.quests9.subtitle: It's kind of like sieving...
sg.intro.quests9.tasks0.title: What is this?
sg.intro.quests10.description0: Vanilla mechanics for Bone Meal in a Composter. You can easily automate it with a Random Sapling Generator and a couple Hoppers.
sg.intro.quests10.subtitle: Looking for Bone Meal?
sg.intro.quests11.description0: Home Command - Type /sethome to set a home. Type /home to teleport to that home.
sg.intro.quests11.description1: Twerking - Mash sneak to twerk and speed up plant/sapling growth.
sg.intro.quests11.description2: FTB Ultimine - Hold the grave key [`] and harvest blocks to harvest up to 64 of that same block as long as they are connected. Just dont mine up your entire base!
sg.intro.quests11.description3: Void Garbage - There are actually 2 types of trash cans in your inventory, press [T] to enable a Trash Slot at the bottom of your inventory, or look in the top left of your screen to find the Trash Can, or just take advantage of the ability to hold the throw button [Q] to toss things as far as you can into the void. All options have their own benefits. There is also an Item Trash Can block you can place in the world to pipe items into.
sg.intro.quests11.description4: Chunk Claiming - In the top left of your screen when you open your inventory there is a small button that looks like a grid map. This is FTB Chunks, left click a tile to \"Claim\" the chunk, preventing explosion damage (and more). Shift click a tile to \"Force Load\" the chunk, meaning it will stay loaded and operating when you are not nearby.
sg.intro.quests11.description5: Quest Rewards - Quests will sometimes offer very useful things for the stage you are at but don't always expect rewards. Quests are mostly to show progression.
sg.intro.quests11.description6: Phantoms - Phantoms exist, either build a roof or a Bed.
sg.intro.quests11.description7: Extreme Sound Muffler - There are a lot of sounds in GregTech, especially in the steam age, you can mute any sound you wish by clicking on the volume icon in your inventory to the right of your player model. Note you can also just smack the machine with a Hammer if you want to only mute a single machine.
sg.intro.quests11.description8: Peaceful Mode - It's a valid option, you may be thinking you need a bunch of Ender Pearls, Ender Pearl Dust is craftable in the LV age using ore material. &nEnder Pearl Dust can be converted into Ender Pearls in an Autoclave with Water&r. While Peaceful Mode may take some extra work, it is an option.
sg.intro.quests11.description9: AE2 - Applied Energistics 2 is meant to be as accessible as possible with basically no changed recipes and access in the LV age. Recipes have only been added to fit a skyblock modpack and &nchannels have been disabled&r to allow easier automation for the mass amount of machines you will have.
sg.intro.quests11.subtitle: Read me!
sg.intro.quests11.tasks0.title: Useful Things
sg.intro.quests12.description0: The Nether is a void dimension as well but it still has structures.
sg.intro.quests12.description1: Build a portal as normal with Obsidian or craft a Nether Painting. If using Paintings for travel, remember to bring an Overworld Painting with you to get back as they do not create a return.
sg.intro.quests12.description2: The only reason you will probably need to go here is for Nether Air.
sg.intro.quests12.description3: You have to &njump&r into the Painting.
sg.intro.quests12.subtitle: Void with structures!
sg.intro.quests12.tasks0.title: The Nether
sg.intro.quests13.description0: The End is a void dimension as well but it still has and End Island and Ender Dragon.
sg.intro.quests13.description1: There is no Stronghold. Craft an End Painting. If using Paintings for travel, remember to bring an Overworld Painting with you to get back as they do not create a return.
sg.intro.quests13.description2: The only reason you will probably need to go here is for Ender Air. An Enderman farm wouldn't hurt to have though.
sg.intro.quests13.description3: You have to &njump&r into the Painting.
sg.intro.quests13.subtitle: Void with an Ender Dragon!
sg.intro.quests13.tasks0.title: The End
sg.intro.quests14.description0: GregTech Item Pipes and Fluid Pipes can be buggy, due to this Modular Routers, LaserIO and Conduits from EnderIO have been added for more transfer options.
sg.intro.quests14.description1: In some situations they seem to work fine but in others they stop working and let's just say I'm tired of machines exploding.
sg.intro.quests14.subtitle: IO!
sg.intro.quests14.tasks0.title: Pipez
sg.intro.quests14.title: Transfer Options
sg.intro.quests15.description0: Quests are being worked on constantly, quests and quest chapters will be added, updated, or removed.
sg.intro.quests15.description1: Some quests have no text as of now but everything is to be finished rather soon.
sg.intro.quests15.subtitle: WIP!
sg.intro.quests15.tasks0.title: Quests
sg.intro.quests16.description0: Harvest Cobblestone with a Crushing Hammer.
sg.intro.quests16.description2: You already have an active Cobble Gen on your platform if you haven't found it yet.
sg.intro.quests16.subtitle: Cobblestone -> Gravel!
sg.intro.quests17.description0: Harvest Gravel with a Crushing Hammer.
sg.intro.quests17.subtitle: Gravel -> Sand!
sg.intro.quests18.description0: Use Dust on a Primitive Water Condenser to create Clay. Use the stone dust variants you get from mining ores on a Primitive Water Condenser to create Clay Balls.
sg.intro.quests18.description1: You can also craft Clay with a GT Hammer to break the Clay down into Clay Balls.
sg.intro.quests18.subtitle: Dust -> Clay!
sg.intro.quests19.description0: Harvest Sand with a Crushing Hammer.
sg.intro.quests19.description1: Use on the Primitive Water Condenser to create Clay.
sg.intro.quests19.subtitle: Sand -> Dust!
sg.intro.quests20.description0: Harvest Dirt with a Crushing Hammer.
sg.intro.quests20.description1: You have a chance to get a random sapling or Plant Fibers, which can be used as and also turned into String.
sg.intro.quests20.description2: You already have an active Dirt Gen on your platform if you haven't found it yet.
sg.intro.quests20.subtitle: Dirt -> Plant Fiber!
sg.intro.quests21.description0: Phantoms are annoying, sleep to keep them away for a few more days. You can also just build a roof and they won't bother you. They will only spawn if your head can see the sky.
sg.intro.quests21.description1: While a normal Bed requires Wool, if you get Leather instead you can craft a Furniture Station and make a Bed from Fantasy's Furniture using a Clay Ball, Planks, and Cobblestone.
sg.intro.quests21.subtitle: Stay away Phantoms!
sg.intro.quests21.tasks0.title: Bed
sg.intro.quests22.description0: Harvest Gravel with your hands for a chance of obtaining Flint.
sg.intro.quests22.description1: Use FTB Ultimine to harvest a stack at once.
sg.intro.quests22.description2: Once you can make Stone in a Furnace you can craft a Mortar to obtain Flint much easier.
sg.intro.quests22.subtitle: Vanilla mechanics!
sg.intro.quests23.description0: Pretty simple blocks, will generate 1 random sapling or seed per second and store it in its internal inventory. Use a Hopper or any other method to automate them.
sg.intro.quests23.description1: If you need seeds look into the Composter quest for Bone Meal and use the Bone Meal on a Grass Block, or buy them from the Market block.
sg.intro.quests23.subtitle: Saplings \& seeds!
sg.intro.quests23.title: More Random Generators
sg.intro.quests24.description0: Well it's day 641 and I finally killed that damned Ender Dragon, I made a sword for the first time just to kill that thing.
sg.intro.quests24.subtitle: Day 641...
sg.intro.quests24.tasks0.title: Captain's Log
sg.intro.title: Basics
sg.iv_age.quests0.subtitle: LuV Circuits!
sg.iv_age.quests1.description0: Just as Tungstensteel was the main material for the IV age, Rhodium Plated Palladium is the main material for the LuV age.
sg.iv_age.quests1.subtitle: LuV material!
sg.iv_age.quests2.description0: Process Rhodium Dust and Palladium Dust in an IV Mixer to produce Rhodium Plated Palladium Dust.
sg.iv_age.quests2.subtitle: IV Mixer!
sg.iv_age.quests3.description0: Process Rhodium Sulfate in an MV Electrolyzer to produce Rhodium Dust.
sg.iv_age.quests3.subtitle: MV Electrolyzer!
sg.iv_age.quests4.description0: Process Inert Metal Mixture and Sulfuric Acid in an EV Chemical Reactor to produce Rhodium Sulfate.
sg.iv_age.quests4.subtitle: Inert Metal Mixture + Sulfuric Acid!
sg.iv_age.quests5.description0: Used to craft IV related energy items.
sg.iv_age.quests5.subtitle: IV Assembler!
sg.iv_age.quests10.description0: You can upgrade your multiblock generators to produce more energy by switching out the Dynamo Hatch. This will triple the EU/t of the generator. You will need to provide Oxygen as well.
sg.iv_age.quests10.subtitle: IV Assembler!
sg.iv_age.quests11.description0: A multiblock version of the Chemical Reactor. While it can process anything that a normal Chemical Reactor can, it also has some special recipes that can only be processed in the Large Chemical Reactor, like Iridium Metal Residue.
sg.iv_age.quests11.description1: Some recipes with multiple Chemical Reactor steps can be condensed into 1 recipe in the Large Chemical Reactor to skip processing steps.
sg.iv_age.quests11.description2: You can lock the Output Hatch or Bus of a multiblock by inserting a Filter as a Cover on the Output Hatch or Bus.
sg.iv_age.quests11.description3: The items listed are the minimum requirements without Hatches or Busses.
sg.iv_age.quests11.subtitle: Multiblock!
sg.iv_age.quests12.description0: Process Platinum Group Sludge and Aqua Regia in an HV Centrifuge to produce Rarest Metal Mixture.
sg.iv_age.quests12.subtitle: Platinum Group Sludge + Aqua Regia!
sg.iv_age.quests13.description0: Process HPIC Wafers in an IV Cutter to produce HPIC Chips.
sg.iv_age.quests13.subtitle: IV Cutter!
sg.iv_age.quests14.description0: Process MPIC Wafers, Indium Gallium Phosphide Dust, and Liquid Vanadium Gallium in an IV Chemical Reactor in a Cleanroom to produce HPIC Wafers.
sg.iv_age.quests14.subtitle: MPIC Wafer + Indium Gallium Phosphide Dust + Liquid Vanadium Gallium!
sg.iv_age.quests15.description0: Process Aluminium Dust and Indium Concentrate in an EV Chemical Reactor to produce Indium Dust.
sg.iv_age.quests15.subtitle: Aluminium Dust + Indium Concentrate!
sg.iv_age.quests16.description0: Process Purified Sphalerite Ore, Purified Galena Ore, and Sulfuric Acid in an HV Mixer to produce Indium Concentrate.
sg.iv_age.quests16.subtitle: Purified Sphalerite Ore + Purified Galena Ore + Sulfuric Acid!
sg.iv_age.quests17.description0: Process Indium Dust, Gallium Dust, and Phosphorus Dust in a ULV Mixer to produce Indium Gallium Phosphide Dust.
sg.iv_age.quests17.subtitle: Indium Dust + Gallium Dust + Phosphorus Dust!
sg.iv_age.quests18.description0: Process Polyvinyl Butyral and Tempered Glass in an HV Forming Press to Produce Laminated Glass.
sg.iv_age.quests18.subtitle: Polyvinyl Butyral Plate + Tempered Glass!
sg.iv_age.quests19.description0: Process Liquid Polyvinyl Butyral in a ULV Fluid Solidifier to produce Polyvinyl Butyral Plates.
sg.iv_age.quests19.subtitle: Polyvinyl Butyral Plate + Tempered Glass!
sg.iv_age.quests20.description0: Process Polyvinyl Acetate and Butyraldehyde in an HV Chemical Reactor to produce Liquid Polyvinyl Butyral.
sg.iv_age.quests20.subtitle: Polyvinyl Acetate + Butyraldehyde!
sg.iv_age.quests21.description0: You now have the ability to generate FE using Advanced Generators. You can convert it into EU as normal. You can place an Energy Converter directly touching the Flux Generator.
sg.iv_age.quests21.description2: These generators can scale quite high, holding up to 50 Turbines per generator. The highest tier Turbines are not available until the LuV age.
sg.iv_age.quests21.description3: &aDefault generation rates for Turbines have been buffed. All fuel types from GregTech can be used in a Gas Turbine. GregTech Steam and Advanced Generators Steam are interchangable.&r
sg.iv_age.quests21.description4: GregTech will always be a better energy solution in the long run but this is an option for now. The highest tier Turbine is gated behind Naquadah Alloy.
sg.iv_age.quests21.subtitle: Flexible multiblocks!
sg.iv_age.quests21.tasks0.title: Advanced Generators
sg.iv_age.quests22.description0: This is not a multiblock Assembler, however it is similar.
sg.iv_age.quests22.description1: The setup of this multiblock is similar to the setup of a Distillation Tower. You need to extend the multiblock for however many inputs the recipe has. If your recipe has 8 input materials, it will need 8 Input Busses.
sg.iv_age.quests22.description2: The items listed are the minimum requirements without Hatches or Busses.
sg.iv_age.quests22.subtitle: Not a multiblock Assembler!
sg.iv_age.quests24.description0: A central energy storage multiblock. The tier of the Substation Dynamo Hatch you use determines the energy output rate.
sg.iv_age.quests24.description1: Allows up to 18 layers of Capacitors, the Capacitors do not need the be the same tier.
sg.iv_age.quests24.description2: Loses energy equal to 1%% of total capacity every 24 hours. Capped at 100k EU/t of loss.
sg.iv_age.quests24.subtitle: Expandable!
sg.iv_age.quests25.description0: Process Tungstensteel Dust, Chromium Dust, Molybdenum Dust, and Vanadium Dust in an EV Mixer to produce HSS-G Dust.
sg.iv_age.quests25.subtitle: Tungstensteel Dust + Chromium Dust + Molybdenum Dust + Vanadium Dust!
sg.iv_age.quests26.description0: Process Hot HSS-G Ingots in an MV Vacuum Freezer to produce HSS-G Ingots.
sg.iv_age.quests26.subtitle: MV Vacuum Freezer!
sg.iv_age.quests27.subtitle: IV Assembler!
sg.iv_age.quests27.title: HSS-G Coils
sg.iv_age.quests37.description0: Has a loss of 0 EU per block.
sg.iv_age.quests37.subtitle: IV Superconductor!
sg.iv_age.quests38.description0: Process Rare Earth in an LV Centrifuge to produce Small Piles of Samarium Dust.
sg.iv_age.quests39.description0: Process Samarium Dust, Iron Dust, Arsenic Dust, and Oxygen Gas in an IV Mixer to produce Samarium Iron Arsenic Oxide Dust.
sg.iv_age.quests40.description0: Craft Small Piles of Samarium Dust in an Crafting Grid to produce Samarium Dust.
sg.iv_age.title: IV Age
sg.laserio.quests0.description0: LaserIO is all about sending items, fluids, FE, and redstone signals through lasers.
sg.laserio.quests0.description1: The main block of the mod is the Laser Node. You will have 1 of these every time you want to insert or extract something.
sg.laserio.quests0.description2: You need to insert Cards into the Laser Node in order for it to function. Change the Card to insert or extract mode by right clicking with or on the Card and opening the GUI. This is where you can also set Filters and Overclockers.
sg.laserio.quests0.description3: Use a Laser Wrench to connect Laser Nodes together and if you need to travel more than 8 blocks, use Laser Connectors to travel longer distances.
sg.laserio.quests0.description4: Since Cards do not stack, you can place them in the Card Holder to keep all your Cards, Filters, and Overclockers in 1 container.
sg.laserio.quests0.description5: Filters can be used in a few ways to decide what goes where, and Overclockers can be used to upgrade Cards and Laser Nodes to function faster.
sg.laserio.quests0.subtitle: Laser transfer!
sg.laserio.quests0.tasks0.title: LaserIO
sg.laserio.quests1.description0: A Laser Node is used to interact with things by using Cards. Insert Cards to determine what you want it to do. Can hold up to 9 Cards per face.
sg.laserio.quests1.description1: Right clicking on a face of a Laser Node with a Card in your hand will insert the Card into that face.
sg.laserio.quests1.description2: Link 2 Laser Nodes together with a Laser Wrench. Has a maximum linking range of 8 blocks, farther lengths can be achieved by using Laser Connectors.
sg.laserio.quests1.description4: - Chest with a Laser Node beside it.
sg.laserio.quests1.description5: - In the Laser Node on the face touching the Chest insert an Item Card.
sg.laserio.quests1.description6: - Right click on the Item Card to Open the GUI.
sg.laserio.quests1.description7: - Set this Item Card to Extract.
sg.laserio.quests1.description8: - Another Chest withing 8 blocks with a Laser Node beside it.
sg.laserio.quests1.description9: - Sneak right click with a Laser Wrench on the first Laser Node, right click on the second Laser Node.
sg.laserio.quests1.description10: - In the second Laser Node on the face touching the Chest insert an Item Card.
sg.laserio.quests1.description11: - By default all Cards are set to Insert mode so you shouldn't have to change it.
sg.laserio.quests1.description12: - Now items in the first Chest will be sent to the second Chest.
sg.laserio.quests1.description13: This works the same for items, fluids, FE, and redstone signals.
sg.laserio.quests1.description14: If you need to go farther distances, look into the Laser Connectors.
sg.laserio.quests1.description15: For the glowing issue with shaders, turn off bloom in shaders. \"Options...\" -> \"Video Settings...\" -> \"Shader Packs...\" -> \"Shader Pack Settings...\" -> \"Camera\" -> \"Bloom\": Off.
sg.laserio.quests1.subtitle: The root of transfer!
sg.laserio.quests2.description1: A Laser Node can only connect to another Laser Node or Laser Connector in an 8 block range. If you need to go farther than 8 blocks, you will need to use a Laser Connector as a relay to another Laser Connector or Laser Node.
sg.laserio.quests2.description2: - Connect a Laser Node to a Laser Relay.
sg.laserio.quests2.description3: - Connect the Laser Relay to another Laser Node.
sg.laserio.quests2.description4: - Both Laser Nodes will now interact with each other.
sg.laserio.quests2.description5: Advanced Laser Connectors go much farther distances.
sg.laserio.quests2.subtitle: Go farther!
sg.laserio.quests3.description0: Instead of making an actual link, they send and receive contents through a small void portal, allowing infinite range and cross dimensional distances.
sg.laserio.quests3.subtitle: Go even farther!
sg.laserio.quests4.description0: Used to link together Laser Nodes and/or Laser Connectors.
sg.laserio.quests4.description1: Sneak right click on a block to select that block. Right click on another block to connect to that block.
sg.laserio.quests4.subtitle: Connecting things!
sg.laserio.quests5.description0: Stores and stacks Cards, Overclockers, and Filters.
sg.laserio.quests5.description1: Contents can be accessed while using Laser Nodes.
sg.laserio.quests5.subtitle: Stacks of Cards!
sg.laserio.quests6.description0: Used to copy and paste the settings of Cards from 1 Card to another.
sg.laserio.quests6.description1: - Open a Laser Node containing cards.
sg.laserio.quests6.description2: - Pick up the Card Cloner with your mouse.
sg.laserio.quests6.description3: - Hover over the Card you wish to copy and left click it with the Card Cloner.
sg.laserio.quests6.description4: - Hover over the Card you witsh to paste to and right click it with the Card Cloner.
sg.laserio.quests6.subtitle: Copy \& paste settings!
sg.laserio.quests7.description0: Used to transfer items. Open the GUI by right clicking while holding it or while hovering over it with your mouse while in a Laser Node.
sg.laserio.quests7.description1: You can change the insert/extract mode and insert Filters and Overclockers, as well as change the transfer rate and amounts.
sg.laserio.quests7.subtitle: Transfer items!
sg.laserio.quests8.description0: Used to transfer fluids. Open the GUI by right clicking while holding it or while hovering over it with your mouse while in a Laser Node.
sg.laserio.quests8.description1: You can change the insert/extract mode and insert Filters and Overclockers, as well as change the transfer rate and amounts.
sg.laserio.quests8.subtitle: Transfer fluids!
sg.laserio.quests9.description0: Used to transfer FE (not EU!). Open the GUI by right clicking while holding it or while hovering over it with your mouse while in a Laser Node.
sg.laserio.quests9.description1: You can change the insert/extract mode and insert Filters and Overclockers, as well as change the transfer rate and amounts.
sg.laserio.quests9.subtitle: Transfer FE!
sg.laserio.quests10.description0: Used to transfer redstone signals. Open the GUI by right clicking while holding it or while hovering over it with your mouse while in a Laser Node.
sg.laserio.quests10.description1: You can change the insert/extract mode and signal strength.
sg.laserio.quests10.subtitle: Transfer redstone!
sg.laserio.quests11.description0: Insert into a Card to increase transfer rates and amounts.
sg.laserio.quests11.description1: A maximum of 4 can be applied to a Card.
sg.laserio.quests11.subtitle: Go faster!
sg.laserio.quests12.description0: Insert into a Laser Node. Without Node Overclockers a Laser Node will only work with 1 Card at a time, insert Node Overclockers to increase that number to a maximum to 9 (1 for each Card).
sg.laserio.quests12.description1: A maximum of 8 can be applied to a Laser Node.
sg.laserio.quests12.subtitle: More Cards at once!
sg.laserio.quests13.description0: A basic filter that allows you to choose which items or fluids pass through.
sg.laserio.quests13.subtitle: Choose items/fluids!
sg.laserio.quests14.description0: Used to specify certain amounts of items/fluids that enter the attached inventory.
sg.laserio.quests14.description1: Useful for keeping 1 stack each of certain items stocked inside a machine, like an Alloy Furnace.
sg.laserio.quests14.subtitle: Specify amounts!
sg.laserio.quests15.description0: Place an item in the GUI (or drag from REI) and you will be shown a list of tags that item has. Select the tag you want to be allowed through the Tag Filter.
sg.laserio.quests15.description1: For an example, you can place a Hot Ingot of any kind in the GUI slot and select forge:hot_ingots to allow all Hot Ingots.
sg.laserio.quests15.subtitle: Tag types!
sg.laserio.quests16.description0: Place an item in the Mod Filter to select that entire mod of contents. Only items or fluids from that mod will be allowed to pass.
sg.laserio.quests16.subtitle: An entire mod!
sg.laserio.quests17.description0: Works similar to the Tag Filter but for NBT values instead.
sg.laserio.quests17.description1: Common NBT value types are durability, enchantments, potion types, and more.
sg.laserio.quests17.subtitle: NBT values!
sg.laserio.title: LaserIO
sg.luv_age.quests0.subtitle: ZPM Circuits!
sg.luv_age.quests1.description0: Just as Rhodium Plated Palladium was the main material for the LuV age, Naquadah Alloy is the main material for the ZPM age.
sg.luv_age.quests1.subtitle: ZPM material!
sg.luv_age.quests3.description0: Process Naquadah Ore in various ways to produce Naquadah Dust.
sg.luv_age.quests3.subtitle: Ore material!
sg.luv_age.quests6.subtitle: LuV Assembler!
sg.luv_age.quests6.title: Naquadah Coils
sg.luv_age.quests7.description0: Process Hot Naquadah Ingots in an MV Vacuum Freezer to produce Naquadah Ingots.
sg.luv_age.quests7.subtitle: MV Vacuum Freezer!
sg.luv_age.quests10.description0: You should already have this as a byproduct from producing Iridium Metal Residue in the Large Chemical Reactor.
sg.luv_age.quests12.description0: You can figure this one out, it's not too bad.
sg.luv_age.quests14.description0: Has a loss of 0 EU per block.
sg.luv_age.quests14.subtitle: LuV superconductor!
sg.luv_age.quests19.description0: Required for the Fusion Reactor multiblock.
sg.luv_age.quests19.subtitle: Not your normal Coils!
sg.luv_age.quests20.description0: Combines fluids together using a mass amount of energy.
sg.luv_age.quests20.description1: Requires a significant amount of energy to start the process and more EU/t to keep the process going.
sg.luv_age.quests20.description2: You can substitute some of the Fusion Machine Casings for Fusion Glass, but not all of them.
sg.luv_age.quests20.subtitle: Combining fluids with mass energy!
sg.luv_age.quests21.description0: Process Liquid Europium in a ULV Fluid Solidifier to produce Europium Ingots.
sg.luv_age.quests21.subtitle: ULV Fluid Solidifier!
sg.luv_age.quests22.description0: Process Liquid Neodymium and Hydrogen Gas in a LuV Fusion Reactor to produce Liquid Europium.
sg.luv_age.quests22.subtitle: LuV Fusion Reactor!
sg.luv_age.quests23.description0: Process Neodymiun Ingots in an MV Extractor to produce Liquid Neodymium.
sg.luv_age.quests23.subtitle: MV Extractor!
sg.luv_age.quests32.description0: This multiblock is similar to the Electric Blast Furnace however it makes Molten alloys instead.
sg.luv_age.title: LuV Age
sg.lv_age.quests0.description0: I'm not about to explain how the GregTech power system works, but I will point out some of the basic starter machines and some useful information that will make you life much easier.
sg.lv_age.quests0.description1: The most important thing to know is to always match your tiers of energy. LV Cables for LV machines and Turbines, MV for MV and so on. Providing more energy than a Cable can accept will burn the Cable out. Providing more energy than a machine can accept will blow up the machine.
sg.lv_age.quests0.description2: Consumes 64 mb/t of Steam to produce 32 EU/t. This means if you are using High Pressure Steam Solid Boilers, you will require 5 in order to keep 1 Basic Steam Turbine Generator running.
sg.lv_age.quests0.description3: Highly advised to have a buffer for Steam, as in a Drum or Tank, with the highest capacity you can afford.
sg.lv_age.quests0.description4: The first few machines you should make are the Basic Wiremill, the Basic Bender, and optionally the Basic Extractor, and Basic Fluid Solidifier. These will help you craft basic components much easier.
sg.lv_age.quests0.subtitle: Generating EU!
sg.lv_age.quests1.description0: Can process Ingots into Wires and Wires into Fine Wires.
sg.lv_age.quests1.description1: Some Ingots will be processed directly into Fine Wires as they do not have a Wire.
sg.lv_age.quests1.subtitle: Efficient Wires!
sg.lv_age.quests2.description0: Can process materials into Plates, Foils, and Springs.
sg.lv_age.quests2.subtitle: Efficient Plates, Foils, \& Springs!
sg.lv_age.quests3.description0: Can extract items into liquids and other items.
sg.lv_age.quests3.description1: Mostly used for liquid metals, but Liquid Glass is required for Diodes.
sg.lv_age.quests3.subtitle: Extract everything!
sg.lv_age.quests4.description0: Uses Casting Molds to solidify liquids.
sg.lv_age.quests4.description1: The Casting Molds are not consumed.
sg.lv_age.quests4.subtitle: Fluids to solids!
sg.lv_age.quests5.description0: Think of this as an electric Crafting Table, that can also accept stacks (or less) of items and fluids.
sg.lv_age.quests5.description1: If something can be crafted in a normal Crafting Table and an Assembler, the Assembler recipe is normally cheaper or more efficient in some way.
sg.lv_age.quests5.description2: There are many items that can only be crafted through the Assembler. If you find yourself adding and removing fluids constantly, it is a good idea to have a designated Assembler per fluid type required, as in 1 stocked with Rubber, 1 stocked with Glue, and so on.
sg.lv_age.quests5.description3: If the craft isn't working then chances are it requires a higher tier Assembler, pay attention to the EU/t cost.
sg.lv_age.quests5.description4: These are normally the most expensive machines to craft.
sg.lv_age.quests5.description5: Assemblers are crucial to progression. You will require at least 1 of each tier, sometimes more.
sg.lv_age.quests5.subtitle: Multiple recommended!
sg.lv_age.quests6.description0: The Electric Blast Furnace (called EBF from now on) is a crucial multiblock that will be used forever. The Energy Hatch will determine the EU/t the EBF can use, and the Coils determine the heat that can be used.
sg.lv_age.quests6.description1: Throughout your playthrough you will be upgrading the Energy Hatch and Coils to higher tiers to process higher tier materials.
sg.lv_age.quests6.description2: You will require having an MV energy rating to create Aluminium Ingots which may seem impossible at first, just use 2 LV Energy Hatches at first then replace them with 1 MV Energy Hatch when you can. &nHaving 2 Energy Hatches of a certain tier will increase the EBF to the next tier&r. For example, 2 LV Energy Hatches will allow you to do MV recipes. Each Energy Hatch can accept 2 amps of energy. This is how you will need to increase tiers of the EBF each time. Keep in mind it will take 4 Basic Steam Turbine Generators to power an EBF with an MV energy rating. Since Aluminium Ingots require 120 EU/t and your 4 generators will profuce 128 EU/t, you must have a cable loss of less than 8 EU. Keep your generators as close to the Energy Hatch as possible to avoid cable loss.
sg.lv_age.quests6.description3: This will really start to test your EU production, you may need to have a decent EU storage buffer for your first few Aluminium Ingots.
sg.lv_age.quests6.description4: You will end up having more than 1 of these if you don't want to reconfigure the setup for various recipes, some recipes require different fluid inputs.
sg.lv_age.quests6.description5: Read the Multiblocks quest for more information regarding multiblocks in general.
sg.lv_age.quests6.subtitle: The most important multiblock!
sg.lv_age.quests6.title: Electric Blast Furnace (EBF)
sg.lv_age.quests7.description0: Just as Steel was the main material for the LV age, Aluminium is the main material for the MV age.
sg.lv_age.quests7.subtitle: MV material!
sg.lv_age.quests8.description0: Just like your first circuits being used for LV recipes, these will be used for MV recipes.
sg.lv_age.quests8.description1: Be sure to keep an eye out for easier Circuit recipes as you progress through ages as each tier of Circuits has multiple types available.
sg.lv_age.quests8.subtitle: MV Circuits!
sg.lv_age.quests9.description0: Can process things into Rods, Screws, and more.
sg.lv_age.quests9.subtitle: It rounds things.
sg.lv_age.quests10.description0: The way crafting machines works in GregTech looks very complicated at first but there is a method to it. Crafting components are used A LOT, like Electric Motors and Electric Pistons and such.
sg.lv_age.quests10.description1: If you look you will notice there are different tiers of components, like LV, MV, HV, and so on. Higher tier machines and components are usually almost an identical craft, just using higher tier materials.
sg.lv_age.quests10.description2: Try not to ever craft just 1 when it comes to crafting components, you're going to need a lot of them anyways, even in higher tiers you will still end up making lower tier machines for certain things.
sg.lv_age.quests10.description3: Note: Electric Pumps, Conveyor Modules, and Robot Arms can also be used as a Cover. See Cover quest for more information on Covers.
sg.lv_age.quests10.subtitle: Never just craft 1!
sg.lv_age.quests10.tasks0.title: Components
sg.lv_age.quests11.description0: Certain things can be installed on machines or pipes as a Cover, allowing more automation and features. To edit a cover you need to use a Screwdriver, to remove a Cover you need to use a Crowbar.
sg.lv_age.quests11.description1: Almost any non multiblock machine or block can have a Cover applied, like basic machines, Pipes, Drums, Super Tanks, and more.
sg.lv_age.quests11.description2: An item's tooltip will state if it can be used as a Cover. Because of this you may search REI for \"cover\" and see all available Cover options.
sg.lv_age.quests11.description3: Something to note is an Item Filter and a Fluid Filter can be inserted in a Cover to allow filtering.
sg.lv_age.quests11.subtitle: Machine upgrades!
sg.lv_age.quests11.tasks0.title: Covers
sg.lv_age.quests12.description0: Cuts things, like Blocks into Plates, and other things.
sg.lv_age.quests12.description1: Makes bulk Plate crafting quite fast, making 9 at once.
sg.lv_age.quests12.subtitle: Cut Blocks into Plates!
sg.lv_age.quests13.description0: Has a variety of uses, can mix items and fluids together.
sg.lv_age.quests13.subtitle: Mixing all the things!
sg.lv_age.quests14.description0: Can store up to 4 Batteries which in turn can store EU. There are 4x, 8x, and 16x versions which hold up to that many Batteries, allowing more EU storage. If a Battery contains EU, it will provide it through Cables when needed.
sg.lv_age.quests14.description1: Each Battery in the Battery Buffer that has EU to provide will provide 1 amp, meaning a 4x Battery Buffer filled with Batteries will provide 4 amps, and a 16x Battery Buffer filled with Batteries will provide 16 amps. This is important to determine which Cables you require. So for a 4x Battery Buffer you should be using a 4x Cable, and so on.
sg.lv_age.quests14.description2: &n&4NEVER USE CABLES WITH LESS AMPS THAN YOU ARE SENDING.&r&r
sg.lv_age.quests14.subtitle: EU storage!
sg.lv_age.quests15.description0: Has a few uses but we will focus on Batteries.
sg.lv_age.quests15.description1: The machine is pretty basic, insert your required items and get your crafted item. Batteries come in 3 types, Sodium, Cadmium, and Lithium. Sodium is the worst, Cadmium is in the middle, and Lithium is the best. Since you have access to Raw Lithium anyways you may as well make the best!
sg.lv_age.quests15.description2: Batteries can be inserted into a Battery Buffer, or directly into a machine if you wish. They can also be used to charge portable items by enabling the discharge mode.
sg.lv_age.quests15.description3: Note that Batteries are completely optional. If your power generation is good enough, you don't need to store it, just generate it.
sg.lv_age.quests15.subtitle: Batteries!
sg.lv_age.quests16.description0: This block will convert EU into FE, or FE into EU.
sg.lv_age.quests16.description1: 1 EU converts into 4 FE and 4 FE converts into 1 EU.
sg.lv_age.quests16.description2: Some things from other mods like AE2 and Building Gadgets cannot accept EU which is where this block comes in.
sg.lv_age.quests16.description3: Use a Soft Mallet to change the conversion mode.
sg.lv_age.quests16.description4: Note that AE2 can mostly be handled by the Creative Energy Cell, however you may want an separate system than your main system in some cases.
sg.lv_age.quests16.description5: GregTech EU can power FE related blocks, but not the other way around.
sg.lv_age.quests16.subtitle: EU -> FE \& FE -> EU!
sg.lv_age.quests16.tasks0.title: LV Converters
sg.lv_age.quests17.description0: You may notice the MV Cutter recipe which is not available at the moment. Your first Diodes will have to be crafted using Gallium, which is a byproduct of Sphalerite Dust.
sg.lv_age.quests17.description1: You also require Arsenic Dust but I will leave that up to you.
sg.lv_age.quests17.description2: You will be using these in Circuits until you can craft the SMD Diodes in the HV age.
sg.lv_age.quests17.subtitle: Crafting component!
sg.lv_age.quests18.description0: Splits things into their periodic table elements.
sg.lv_age.quests18.description1: If you see an element in a tooltip that you want, you can most likely obtain it through the Electrolyzer. You'd be surprised what is in a Clay Ball.
sg.lv_age.quests18.subtitle: Splitting the elements!
sg.lv_age.quests19.description0: Splits things into many other things.
sg.lv_age.quests19.description1: Required for obtaining Glue for Phenolic Circuit Boards.
sg.lv_age.quests19.description2: It is not a bad idea to have designated setups for Centrifuging both Rubber Logs and Sticky Resin as the byproducts are going to be useful for a variety of things.
sg.lv_age.quests19.subtitle: Splitting things apart!
sg.lv_age.quests20.description0: Magnetizes things without the need for Redstone Dust.
sg.lv_age.quests20.description1: While Iron Rods can be magnetized with Redstone Dust, Steel Rods and others cannot.
sg.lv_age.quests20.subtitle: No more Redstone Dust!
sg.lv_age.quests21.description0: While it has some other uses, it is mainly used to process gem dusts into gems.
sg.lv_age.quests21.description1: This is also how you can convert GregTech Certus Quartz into AE2 Certus Quartz. Speaking of Certus Quartz... you can craft a Flawless Budding Certus Quartz if you wish.
sg.lv_age.quests21.subtitle: Dusts to gems!
sg.lv_age.quests22.description0: Has many uses but early on can be used to efficient Rubber production.
sg.lv_age.quests22.description1: GregTech is very big on chemicals and mixing chemicals, however they can usually be done in an LV Chemical Reactor. Autocrafting highly advised.
sg.lv_age.quests22.subtitle: Efficient Rubber!
sg.lv_age.quests23.description0: You may be used to inserting an Programmed Circuit with a certain number into a machine for recipes, this system now uses a Ghost Circuit. Since the machines are all crafted with Circuits, why insert another?
sg.lv_age.quests23.description1: On the left side of a machines GUI there is a Circuit Settings tab where you can select the Circuit number you wish without actually inserting a Programmed Circuit.
sg.lv_age.quests23.subtitle: No more Programmed Circuits!
sg.lv_age.quests23.tasks0.title: Ghost Circuits
sg.lv_age.quests24.description0: &n&l&6DON'T EVER BUILD A MULTIBLOCK ACROSS CHUNK BORDERS! PRESS F3+G TO SEE CHUNK BORDERS!&r&r&r
sg.lv_age.quests24.description1: Multiblocks all share a common pattern, the main block, structural blocks, Input/Output Busses, Input/Output Hatches, Energy Hatches, Muffler Hatches, and Maintenance Hatches. Some may have other unique blocks. Some require certain tiers of Hatches and Busses, some do not matter what tiers you use.
sg.lv_age.quests24.description2: The main block: The block you interact with, usually has the name of the multiblock you are building. Always has to be in the exact spot to function.
sg.lv_age.quests24.description3: Structural blocks: Filler blocks used to fill in the rest of the shape of the multiblock. Can usually be changed around with Hatches or Busses.
sg.lv_age.quests24.description4: Busses: Handles the importing and exporting of items. Will automatically interact with adjacent inventories. Can usually be changed around with Busses or structural blocks.
sg.lv_age.quests24.description6: Input/Output Hatches: Same as the above but for fluids.
sg.lv_age.quests24.description7: Energy Hatches: Same as the above but for EU.
sg.lv_age.quests24.description8: Muffler Hatch: Will collect waste after a while.
sg.lv_age.quests24.description9: Maintenance Hatch: Perform maintenance with various tools.
sg.lv_age.quests24.description10: Coils: Coils are in special multiblocks and if there are Coils, then you can usually upgrade the tiers for bonus rates. Effects different multiblocks in different ways.
sg.lv_age.quests24.description11: You can typically change the position of any Busses, Hatches, and structural blocks around but there is usually a minimum requirement of structural blocks, some multiblocks require fluids and items and some only require one or the other. The main block and Coils always have to be in a set location.
sg.lv_age.quests24.description12: You can often upgrade an Energy Hatch to a higher tier to increase the speed, but not in all cases.
sg.lv_age.quests24.description13: A note on Muffler Hatches and Maintenance Hatches. You can't seem to export from the Muffler Hatches in any way but it also doesn't seem to matter if it fills up anyways. Maintenance Hatches need to be \"maintained\" when you first place the block down. Most multiblocks last a very long time before needing any maintenance. If your multiblock has stopped working, check the Maintenance Hatch for issues. Look at the tooltip in the slot in the GUI for more information.
sg.lv_age.quests24.description14: With all of this being said, multiblocks are quite flexible in how you can set them up so the quest pages will usually just have the minimum required blocks without any Hatches or Busses. See the REI page for more information on each multiblock by checking the uses on the main block.
sg.lv_age.quests24.subtitle: A \"quick\" breakdown...
sg.lv_age.quests24.tasks0.title: Multiblocks
sg.lv_age.quests25.description0: Can be used to break blocks, most importantly, ores. If the internal inventory is not full then it will collect the drop, if it is full then the drops will fall in the world. Apply a redstone signal for it to operate.
sg.lv_age.quests25.description1: A great way to obtain raw ores intead of ores. Even the LV version is quite fast, definately faster than mining.
sg.lv_age.quests25.description2: See the picture below for a basic setup.
