sg.lv_age.quests25.description3: You want the Block Breaker facing an ore that is being generated by a Raw Conversion Generator. Extract the items from the Block Breaker using any means and either keep all the dust types or just send them to a Trash Can.
sg.lv_age.quests25.subtitle: Auto mining!
sg.lv_age.quests26.description0: A simple way to put it, the power scaling from tier to tier will cost 4 times the energy to go 2 times faster. To power an MV machine with LV Steam Turbines will require 4 LV Steam Turbines. However you cannot just add lower tier generators together and produce higher tier energy. For that you need a Transformer.
sg.lv_age.quests26.description1: A Transformer can be used to change 4 amps of a lower tier energy to 1 amp of a higher tier energy, and the opposite, 1 amp of higher tier energy to 4 amps of lower tier energy. This behaviour can be changed by using a Screwdriver on it.
sg.lv_age.quests26.description2: While this is possible, it is usually best to keep your energy tiers separate.
sg.lv_age.quests26.subtitle: 4 times more!
sg.lv_age.quests26.tasks0.title: Power Scaling
sg.lv_age.quests27.description0: While there is a Steam version of the Rock Crusher available, I am going to display the LV version as you probably wont be using a Steam version.
sg.lv_age.quests27.description1: The Rock Crusher requires Water and Lava to be placed in the world, touching the machine. Insert a Stone variant in the GUI slot and it will generate that type of Stone. The fluids are not consumed.
sg.lv_age.quests27.description2: The types it can generate are:
sg.lv_age.quests27.subtitle: Stone variant generator!
sg.lv_age.quests28.description0: While you don't need Steam powered machines anymore, you are techincally still using Steam for energy, to generature EU using a Steam Turbine.
sg.lv_age.quests28.description1: I will point out some basics about the GregTech power system along the way but if this is your first time playing with GregTech then I highly advise reading a wiki or watching a video explaining it as there is too much going on to explain here.
sg.lv_age.quests28.description2: Too much energy given to a machine will cause it to explode.
sg.lv_age.quests28.description3: Too much energy given to a Wire or Cable will cause it to burn up.
sg.lv_age.quests28.description4: Not giving enough energy to a machine will reset the progress.
sg.lv_age.quests28.description5: Some multiblocks can have 2 Energy Hatches, which increases the tier.
sg.lv_age.quests28.description6: Wires and Cables can only carry so many amps (like channels) of energy. Running 4 machines at once will require 4 amps.
sg.lv_age.quests28.description7: Transformers can be used to go up or down an energy tier.
sg.lv_age.quests28.description8: There are too many ways to power your base to even mention.
sg.lv_age.quests28.description9: For each energy tier you increase, generators will generate 4 times the energy at 4 times to consumption rate, and machine speed is 2 times faster.
sg.lv_age.quests28.subtitle: Steel!
sg.lv_age.quests28.tasks0.title: LV Age
sg.lv_age.quests29.description0: If you are new to GregTech there are some things you should know about the mod in general. There is more information in the \"New To GregTech\" quest chapter but here is a semi quick breakdown. For more information see the \"New to GregTech\" quest chapter.
sg.lv_age.quests29.description1: Take your time - With an exception for the Steam age, don't rush through progression. If you do you are going to suffer from lack of infrastructure and automation. Once you get to the LV age you should start looking into automating as much as you can with AE2. Being able to request Circuits from your Terminal is going to be a game changer. As you progress into higher ages you should be looking to replace your autocrafting machines with higher tier machines to double the speed.
sg.lv_age.quests29.description2: Amps - How many channels of energy a Wire or Cable can carry. A single block machine will either generate or use 1 amp of energy. The easiest way around this is the use a Battery Buffer. The 4x means to Battery Buffer can hold 4 Batteries. A Battery Buffer will send out the same amount of amps as the amount of filled Batteries it contains, meaning a filled 4x Battery Buffer will send out 4 amps, even if you only have 2 generators. You will need Cables to match the amperage or else the Cables will burn up.
sg.lv_age.quests29.description3: Energy tiers - GregTech is devided into energy tiers. You start in the Steam age with no energy, however Steam will still be how you produce energy for now. As you progress through tiers something important to note is that you will start going through fuels 4 times faster as you are generating 4 times the energy. Machines will operate 2 times faster. Steam will hold up to the LV and MV age quite well but every couple tiers you increase you will want to look for a better fuel option. For instance when I reached the HV age the Steam consumption rate was just too much so I looked into Oil processing for Diesel to use in Combustion Generators.
sg.lv_age.quests29.description4: 1 generator per machine - This is not overkill, especially with unlimited resources, even more so if a recipe requires almost all of the EU/t that the generator makes. A lot of recipes will take 30 EU/t where an LV Steam Turbine only produces 32 EU/t. Just give the 1 machine a dedicated generator to make sure it will always run, especially for certain autocrafting setups that cannot afford to stop. Now obviously if you have 4 machines that all need 4EU/t then a Cable setup is ideal.
sg.lv_age.quests29.description5: Energy loss per block - Wires and Cables have an energy loss per block. This is mostly an issue in the earlier ages as losing 1 eu per block is quite damaging with not much eu to spare. In later ages you will be able to span greater distances with Cables because the EU/t being generated is usually much more than the EU/t required by machines. There are also \"Superconductor Cables\", 1 for each energy tier, which do not lose any energy per block. They are quite expensive but very worth it in certain situations. You should always be trying to craft the Cables for you energy tier with the lowest loss per block that you can afford.
sg.lv_age.quests29.description6: Mobs - You don't need any mobs but some may help. GregTech pretty much ignores all mob drops in the first place, and Netherite for that matter. There are still ways to make crazy mob farms with Apotheosis and Mob Grinding Utilities, but you can play the pack on Peaceful Mode if you wanted. I even trivialized food too so there isn't much difference. With the only real mob drop being used being Ender Pearls, Ender Pearl Dust is craftable from ore resources.
sg.lv_age.quests29.subtitle: A \"quick\" read...
sg.lv_age.quests29.tasks0.title: New to GregTech?
sg.lv_age.quests30.description0: Has a loss of 0 EU per block.
sg.lv_age.quests30.description1: There is a Superconductor Wire for each energy tier that always has 0 EU loss per block. They normally take quite a bit of work to craft.
sg.lv_age.quests30.description2: They also usually have a higher amp rating than other wires of the same size, for example this 1x Wire has 2 amps.
sg.lv_age.quests30.description3: They come in all the standard Wire sizes.
sg.lv_age.quests30.subtitle: LV Superconductor!
sg.lv_age.quests31.description0: Process Manganese Phosphide Dust in an MV EBF to produce Manganese Phosphide Ingots.
sg.lv_age.quests31.description1: This really only has 1 purpose which is to be processed into Wires.
sg.lv_age.quests31.subtitle: Has 1 job!
sg.lv_age.quests32.description0: Process Manganese Dust and Phosphorus Dust in an LV Mixer to obtain Manganaese Phosphide Dust.
sg.lv_age.quests32.description1: Both are byproducts of other resources. Look through EMI to see what suits you best.
sg.lv_age.quests32.subtitle: Mixing byproducts!
sg.lv_age.quests33.description0: A multiblock farming station. Produces large quantities of tree or crop resources without consuming the inputs.
sg.lv_age.quests33.description1: Fertilizer can be added to double the output.
sg.lv_age.quests33.subtitle: Multiblock farming!
sg.lv_age.quests34.description0: Sometimes the only way to obtain a material is as a byproduct of processing something else. Sometimes even in the form of Tiny or Small Piles.
sg.lv_age.quests34.description1: Something to note is that a Macerator will not actually give any byproducts unless you use an HV Macerator or higher, with higher tiers above HV giving additional chance to obtain. This can be confusing looking at recipes sometimes.
sg.lv_age.quests34.subtitle: HV Macerator!
sg.lv_age.quests34.tasks0.title: Byproducts
sg.lv_age.quests35.description1: Will auto output to the block above it.
sg.lv_age.quests35.description2: Production can be increased x10 by placing a Cupronickel Coil Block underneath.
sg.lv_age.quests35.subtitle: Infinite Water!
sg.lv_age.quests36.description1: Will auto output to the block above it.
sg.lv_age.quests36.description2: Production can be increased x10 by placing a Cupronickel Coil Block underneath.
sg.lv_age.quests36.subtitle: Infinite Lava!
sg.lv_age.title: LV Age
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.quests0.descri: Mob Grinding Utilites is a mod all about farming mobs.
The Mob Masher is the main block which actually damages mobs. It can accept upgrades like Looting, Sharpness, and more.
There are different ways to move mobs and items/experience around.
There is more to the mod than I show here, this is just the basics for a mob farm.
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.quests0.title: Mob Grinding Utilities
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.quests1.descri: Damages any mob that touches it.
Requires a redstone signal to operate.
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.quests2.descri: Pushes mobs in the direction it is facing.
Requires a redstone signal to operate.
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.quests3.descri: Moves entities in the direction of the arrow.
Mobs can spawn on this block.
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.quests4.descri: A maximum of 3 may be inserted into the Mob Fan.
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.quests5.descri: A maximum of 3 may be inserted into the Mob Fan.
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.quests6.descri: A maximum of 10 may be inserted into the Mob Fan.
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.quests7.descri: A maximum of 10 may be inserted into the Mob Masher.
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.quests8.descri: A maximum of 10 may be inserted into the Mob Masher.
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.quests9.descri: A maximum of 10 may be inserted into the Mob Masher.
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.quests10.descr: A maximum of 10 may be inserted into the Mob Masher.
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.quests11.descr: A maximum of 10 may be inserted into the Mob Masher.
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.quests12.descr: A maximum of 10 may be inserted into the Mob Masher.
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.quests13.descr: Moves entities in the direction of the arrow.
Mobs can spawn on this block.
Does not take up a full block space.
There are higher tiers which move faster.
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.quests14.descr: Monster Spawners are craftable and Spawn Eggs can be purchased from the Market block. You can use a Spawn Egg on a Monster Spawner to change the Monster Spawner to that mob type.
You can further upgrade a Monster Spawner using certain items, this can be seen be checking the uses for the Monster Spawner in EMI.
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.quests15.descr: Collects items and experience. Can auto output items and fluid experience from any side using the GUI.
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.quests16.descr: A maximum of 6 may be inserted into the Absorption Hopper.
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.quests17.descr: Dreadful Dirt spawns hostile mobs very quickly as long the spawning conditions are correct.
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.quests18.descr: Delightful Dirt spawns passive creatures very quickly as long the spawning conditions are correct.
sg.mob_grinding_utilities.title: Mob Farms
sg.mv_age.quests0.description0: Chromium Dust can be Electrolyzed from Ruby Dust and others.
sg.mv_age.quests0.description1: The others should be self explanitory.
sg.mv_age.quests0.description2: Mix these together in an MV Mixer to obtain Stainless Steel Dust.
sg.mv_age.quests0.description3: Processed in an EBF with an HV energy requirement.
sg.mv_age.quests0.subtitle: Almost there!
sg.mv_age.quests1.description0: Just as Aluminium was the main material for the MV age, Stainless Steel is the main material for the HV age.
sg.mv_age.quests1.subtitle: HV material!
sg.mv_age.quests2.description0: Just like going from LV to MV, you will need 2 MV Energy Hatches in order to make your first crafts requiring HV EU requirements.
sg.mv_age.quests2.description1: This quest only calls for 1 MV Energy Hatch as I assume you already made and installed the other 1.
sg.mv_age.quests2.subtitle: More energy!
sg.mv_age.quests3.description0: Required for obtaining Silicon Wafers and other materials.
sg.mv_age.quests3.subtitle: MV recipes!
sg.mv_age.quests4.description0: These take a very long time to craft, and a lot of energy. They are basically an energy check to make sure you have your energy generation or storage up to the task.
sg.mv_age.quests4.description1: Must be processed in an MV Cutter.
sg.mv_age.quests4.subtitle: Your first Boule!
sg.mv_age.quests6.description0: Uses different Lenses to shape various items into other items, Lenses are not consumed.
sg.mv_age.quests6.subtitle: 21 different Lenses!
sg.mv_age.quests7.description0: Process in an MV Cutter to produce ULPIC Chips.
sg.mv_age.quests7.subtitle: It has 1 job...
sg.mv_age.quests8.description0: While you can craft these using LV machines, the MV route in a Lathe is much easier.
sg.mv_age.quests8.subtitle: LV or MV?
sg.mv_age.quests9.description0: Processed in an MV Laser Engraver with different Lenses to produce various Wafers.
sg.mv_age.quests10.description0: Required for obtaining Vanadium Steel Dust, Stainless Steel Dust, and other materials.
sg.mv_age.quests10.subtitle: MV recipes!
sg.mv_age.quests11.description0: Required for obtaining Chromium Dust and other materials.
sg.mv_age.quests11.subtitle: MV recipes!
sg.mv_age.quests12.description0: Just like your second circuits being used for MV recipes, these will be used for HV recipes.
sg.mv_age.quests12.subtitle: HV circuits!
sg.mv_age.quests13.description1: Most Circuits can only be crafted using this.
sg.mv_age.quests13.subtitle: Only Circuits!
sg.mv_age.quests14.description0: The second MV Circuit, can be used in place of the original MV Circuits.
sg.mv_age.quests14.subtitle: This is the second MV Circuit!
sg.mv_age.quests15.description0: The second LV Circuit, can be used in place of the original LV Circuits.
sg.mv_age.quests15.subtitle: This is the second LV Circuit!
sg.mv_age.quests17.description0: Process in an MV Cutter to produce ILC Chips.
sg.mv_age.quests17.subtitle: It has 1 job...
sg.mv_age.quests18.description0: While you can craft these using LV machines, the MV route in a Lathe is much easier.
sg.mv_age.quests18.subtitle: LV or MV?
sg.mv_age.quests19.description0: Has many uses, required for many different Circuits.
sg.mv_age.quests19.description1: You will want a designated chain setup for this.
sg.mv_age.quests19.subtitle: Finally!
sg.mv_age.quests20.subtitle: So close!
sg.mv_age.quests21.description0: Required for crafting Transistors and other materials.
sg.mv_age.quests21.subtitle: MV recipes!
sg.mv_age.quests22.description0: Has quite a few way to produce, pick a path and make it efficient.
sg.mv_age.quests22.description1: Our main purpose for now is Liquid Polyethylene but it has quite a few other uses, including Gas Turbine fuel or processing further into even better fuel. If looking for a better fuel source, look into Diesel.
sg.mv_age.quests22.description2: Mix with Oxygen in an LV Chemical Reactor for Liquid Polyethylene.
sg.mv_age.quests22.subtitle: Just add the poly!
sg.mv_age.quests23.description0: Mix in an MV Chemical Reactor to produce Ethylene.
sg.mv_age.quests23.description1: Sulfuric Acid is actually just Sulfur and Water as base materials.
sg.mv_age.quests23.description2: Sulfuric Acid can be made a couple different ways.
sg.mv_age.quests23.description3: You are going to want a dedicated Electrolyzer for processing Water.
sg.mv_age.quests23.subtitle: Can be fuel too!
sg.mv_age.quests23.title: Ethanol \& Sulfuric Acid
sg.mv_age.quests24.description0: Only 1 of these liquids are required.
sg.mv_age.quests24.description1: Check EMI for the recipe of Ethanol, there are 3 options.
sg.mv_age.quests24.description2: Biomass: Easy to produce, just requires vegetables (Bio Chaff is significantly better) and a Brewery with ULV power requirements. 500 mB of Biomass produces 300 mB of Ethanol and 1 Small Pile of Wood Dust. This produces the most Ethanol per mB of input material.
sg.mv_age.quests24.description3: Fermented Biomass: Easy to produce, run the Biomass listed above through a Fermenter with a ULV power requirement. 1000 mB of Fermented Biomass produces 150 mB of Ethanol and 1 Fertilizer.
sg.mv_age.quests24.description4: Wood Vinegar: Not as easy to produce as the products above, requires a Pyrolyse Oven which has MV power requirements. 1000 mB of Wood Vinegar produces 10 mB of Ethanol. This is more of something you do with leftover Wood Vinegar. This is not a very viable method for main production.
sg.mv_age.quests24.description5: Note there are some other ways to obtain the input materials but these are the basic ways, look into Bio Chaff if you really want to boost production.
sg.mv_age.quests24.description6: When you reach the HV age you can set up a Distillation Tower multiblock that can significantly increase production values of materials listed above.
sg.mv_age.quests24.subtitle: Probably Biomass...
sg.mv_age.quests24.tasks3.title: Obtained
sg.mv_age.quests24.title: Choices
sg.mv_age.quests25.description0: Note the hatch requirements in the multiblock viewer don't really make sense, all recipes are either LV or MV so you would need a Energy Hatch to match that.
sg.mv_age.quests25.description1: As the input and output Hatches are all quite configurable, I will leave that up to you, be weary of the output amounts particularily for fluids. Some recipes will produce more outputs than a ULV hatch can hold.
sg.mv_age.quests25.description2: Aside from all the other stuff to do with Ethanol, this is an by all means an electric Coke Oven. Anything you can do in a Coke Oven you can do here but much faster. The Coil tier determines the speed.
sg.mv_age.quests25.description3: You can also produce Biomass and Fermented Biomass using Bio Chaff and Water.
sg.mv_age.quests25.description4: The items listed are the minimum requirements without Hatches or Busses.
sg.mv_age.quests25.subtitle: Electric Coke Oven!
sg.mv_age.quests26.description0: Can efficiently craft many metal materials like Plates, Rods, Gears, Rotors, and so on.
sg.mv_age.quests26.description1: Requires Extruder Molds but they are not consumed.
sg.mv_age.quests26.description2: Advised to have 1 of these for each material type you want to make.
sg.mv_age.quests26.subtitle: Efficiency!
sg.mv_age.quests27.description0: Note you do still require Kanthal, which will require either an MV Chemical Bath or a Vacuum Freezer to cool down the Hot Kanthal Ingots, but I thought this was a good place to put this.
sg.mv_age.quests27.description1: You can craft Bedrock and Bedrock Breakers. This is for the few things that require interacting with Bedrock.
sg.mv_age.quests27.subtitle: Craftable!
sg.mv_age.quests28.description0: Consumes (4x more) fuel to produce up to 128 EU/t (4x more).
sg.mv_age.quests28.description1: Make sure your machines and Cables can handle the MV energy ratings.
sg.mv_age.quests28.subtitle: 128 EU/t! (MV)
sg.mv_age.quests29.description0: Process Hot Silicon Ingots and Water in an MV Chemical Bath to produce Silicon Ingots.
sg.mv_age.quests29.description1: Don't convert your entire supply of Silicon Dust into Silicon Ingots, more Silicon Dust is normally required.
sg.mv_age.quests29.subtitle: Choices!
sg.mv_age.quests30.description0: These Coils will allow your EBF to go up to a heat of 2700 K, allowing the production of certain Hot Ingots and more.
sg.mv_age.quests30.description1: Any multiblock requiring Coils can be upgraded with these Coils, and any other kind of Coils in the future, increasing certain stats of the multiblock.
sg.mv_age.quests30.description2: Hot Ingots must be cooled down, they will burn you if you carry them. Some can be cooled down in a Chemical Bath with Water, more advanced Hot Ingots require a Vacuum Freezer multiblock.
sg.mv_age.quests30.subtitle: Making Hot Ingots!
sg.mv_age.quests30.title: Kanthal Coils
sg.mv_age.quests31.description0: Has many uses but for now we will focus on cooling down Hot Ingots.
sg.mv_age.quests31.description1: Hot Ingots will need to be cooled down before they can be used, for now this requires Water or Distilled Water In an MV Chemical Bath.
sg.mv_age.quests31.description2: Later you can make a multiblock Vacuum Freezer with EV Circuits that is faster.
sg.mv_age.quests31.subtitle: Cooling down Hot Ingots!
sg.mv_age.quests32.description0: Not too difficult to obtain and is one of the better fuel sources you can get your hands on right now.
sg.mv_age.quests32.description1: Will produce 480 EU in 0.75 seconds (at 32 EU/t) in a Combustion Generator which is significantly better rates than most other fuels.
sg.mv_age.quests32.description2: Everything starts with Oilsands Ore and a Centrifuge.
sg.mv_age.quests32.description3: You can split the Oil you obtain into 2 different Distilleries, 1 for Sulfuric Light Fuel and 1 for Sulfuric Heavy Fuel.
sg.mv_age.quests32.description4: Take your Sulfuric Fuels and run them through a Chemical Reactor with Hydrogen to remove the Hydrogen Sulfide and leave you with clean Fuels.
sg.mv_age.quests32.description5: Finally mix your Light Fuel and Heavy Fuel in a Mixer for Diesel.
sg.mv_age.quests32.description6: Later on you can further refine your Diesel to make it even better.
sg.mv_age.quests32.description7: Note this is just 1 better fuel type, there are many ways you can power your base, Benzene to name 1. There are also other ways to obtain Diesel but this is the \"easier\" path for now.
sg.mv_age.quests32.subtitle: Better fuel!
sg.mv_age.quests32.title: Diesel
sg.mv_age.quests33.description0: The Multi Smelter is a very fast smelter.
sg.mv_age.quests33.description1: The speed will depend on the tier of Energy Hatch you use, and the amount it processes at once will depend on the tier of Coils you use.
sg.mv_age.quests33.description2: You can change the \"Active Machine Mode\" in the GUI by clicking the button that looks like a Robot Arm. This will allow you to change between Electric Furnace and Alloy Smelter recipes.
sg.mv_age.quests33.description3: The items listed are the minimum requirements without Hatches or Busses.
sg.mv_age.quests33.subtitle: Upgradable!
sg.mv_age.quests34.description0: Mix in an HV Chemical Reactor to produce Ethylene.
sg.mv_age.quests34.subtitle: HV option!
sg.mv_age.quests34.title: Glycerol \& Carbon Dioxide
sg.mv_age.quests35.description0: A Distillery (or Distillation Tower) can offer many ways to obtain Ethylene, if you want to go this route look through REI and see what you want to use.
sg.mv_age.quests35.subtitle: Many choices!
sg.mv_age.quests35.tasks0.title: Distillation
sg.mv_age.quests36.description0: Ethylene is essential for progression, but it has a few ways you can obtain it. Whatever path you decide to go down for Ethylene production, just make sure it is an efficient setup as you will be going through quite a bit of Liquid Polyethylene. Some other things will require Ethylene down the road as well.
sg.mv_age.quests36.description1: For this reason, all of the quests leading up to Ethylene are optional and only 1 needs to be completed, pick a path. There are more paths than listed here, look through EMI and find what is best for you.
sg.mv_age.quests36.subtitle: Which way?
sg.mv_age.quests36.tasks0.title: A Note on Ethylene
sg.mv_age.quests37.description0: While you can craft these using LV machines, the MV route in a Lathe is much easier.
sg.mv_age.quests37.subtitle: LV or MV?
sg.mv_age.quests38.description0: Process in an MV Cutter to produce RAM Chips.
sg.mv_age.quests38.subtitle: It has 1 job...
sg.mv_age.quests39.description0: Used in many different Circuit recipes. You are going to want to craft these in bulk or automate them.
sg.mv_age.quests39.subtitle: Random access memory!
sg.mv_age.quests40.description0: Has a loss of 0 EU per block.
sg.mv_age.quests40.subtitle: MV superconductor!
sg.mv_age.title: MV Age
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests0.description0: GregTech has a lot going on, if you are new to GregTech take some time to look over the following informational quests.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests0.description1: The basic idea of the mod is to progress through the different energy tiers, or voltage tiers/ages as they are often called. Each voltage tier will have a few things in common. You always need to produce a new ingot type and a new Circuit type in order to progress. There are some other staples for each age as well but if you are new to the mod then it is best to focus on the ingots and Circuits for now.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests0.description2: You start off with hand tools, quickly progressing into Steam power, then into multiple different tiers of electrical energy.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests0.description3: The energy system in GregTech is NOT like FE you are used to in other mods.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests0.description4: As this modpack contains very easy ways to obtain infinite resources, everything from start to finish for any product can be 100%% automated. Keep this in mind as you progress, the more complete automations you setup the better off you will be in the long run.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests0.description5: Some of this information will be repeated again throughout the quest book, this is a condensed informational page.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests0.subtitle: Progression!
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests0.tasks0.title: GregTech Basics
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests1.description0: Item and Fluid Pipes require a Wrench to interact with them. When you place one down you may interact with the grid that you see on another Pipe to automatically connect to it, otherwise you need a wrench to connect/disconnect Pipes.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests1.description1: Different Pipes from GregTech have different transfer rates, and for Fluid Pipes there are different tempurature ratings, as well as if it can handle gases or not. Different fluids have different tempuratures and some are specifically gases, this will be stated in the fluid's tooltip.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests1.description2: Pipes will not automatically import or export things, you can attach a Conveyor (for items) or an Electric Pump (for fluids) and configure it with a Screwdriver in order to do that, or just have a machine auto export into the Pipe.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests1.subtitle: Use a Wrench!
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests1.tasks0.title: Wrenches
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests1.title: Pipes
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests2.description0: There are a variety of different hand tools that are both used for crafting and in world use. The material the tool is made of only effects the tool's durability and harvest level, some materials come crafted with enchantments. Crafting recipes requiring hand tools usually always have a machine recipe available as well.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests2.description1: Using hand tools to craft will use some durability from the tool, however there is a mod in this pack that allows you to make hand tools (or anything with durability) Unbreakable by using them on a Block of Netherite.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests2.description2: Some hand tools can be used in world to edit certain things.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests2.description3: Hammer - Can be used to mute a machine. Harvesting a block in the world will act as if it was run through a Forge Hammer. This allows GT Hammers to be used for obtaining Gravel, Sand, and Dust as well.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests2.description4: Wrench - Can be used to connect or disconnect Pipes, set output sides for machines, set the steam vent side for steam machines, and rotate machines.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests2.description5: Wire Cutter - Can be used to connect or disconnect Wires/Cables.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests2.description6: Screwdriver - Can be used to edit Covers and various blocks like Drums.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests2.description7: Crowbar - Can be used to remove Covers from machines.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests2.subtitle: More than just crafting!
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests2.tasks0.title: Hand Tools
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests3.description0: GregTech uses crafting components like Electric Motors, Electric Pistons, Robot Arms, and more. These crafting components are used in almost every machine recipe. If you try to craft everything as you need it you will go crazy. Craft these components in bulk and eventually automate them. It is good practice to automate as much as you can from start to finish to make passive lines of products.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests3.description1: The same goes for Circuits, a Circuit is needed for every machine you make and also sometimes used for other components as well.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests3.description2: Having a healthy supply of crafting components and Circuits will same you a lot of time.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests3.description3: For more information on Circuits see the \"Progression\" quest chapter.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests3.subtitle: Never just craft 1!
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests3.tasks0.title: Crafting Components
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests4.description0: Tag Filters act a little differently than normal Filters, you can type different commands and text to make more complicated filtering.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests4.description1: Namespacing: Tags are often namespaced for better organization, which means they are prefixed with a domain followed by a colon. For instance, minecraft:ores/iron might be a tag for iron ore. When using tag filters, you'd need to specify the full namespaced tag.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests4.description2: Wildcard *: Wildcards are still used to match any sequence of characters, but you might need to be more specific about where in the tag's hierarchy you're applying it. For example, minecraft:ores/* could match any ore type defined under the ores category in the minecraft namespace.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests4.description3: Exclusion !: To exclude items with certain tags, you would use the exclamation mark. For example, !minecraft:ores/iron would exclude iron ore from the selection.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests4.description4: Combining Conditions: To combine multiple conditions, you might use a logical AND (;) or OR (,), depending on the system. For example, minecraft:ores/iron; !minecraft:ingots/iron could mean \"include iron ore but exclude iron ingots.\"
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests4.subtitle: Combine specific filters!
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests4.tasks0.title: Covers
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests4.title: Tag Filters
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests5.description0: Covers can be installed on almost any block from GregTech to add functionality. Use a Screwdriver or use the GUI to change the settings of an installed Cover. Use a Crowbar to remove a Cover.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests5.description1: Conveyor: Can be used to import or export items.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests5.description2: Robot Arm: Can be used to specify exact amounts of items being transfered at a time or to keep exact stock levels of a certain item in an inventory.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests5.description3: Electric Pump: Can be used to import or export fluids.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests5.description4: Fluid Regulator: Can be used to specify exact amounts of fluids being transfered at a time or to keep exact stock levels of a certain fluid in an inventory.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests5.description5: Item/Fluid Filter: Can be used as a Cover or can also be inserted into other Covers, allowing the other Covers to filter as you wish.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests5.subtitle: Machine configuration!
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests5.tasks0.title: Covers
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests6.description0: Tier Progression: GregTech introduces a progression system through different voltage tiers, starting from lower tiers like Low Voltage (LV) and moving up to higher tiers such as Medium Voltage (MV), High Voltage (HV), and beyond. Each subsequent tier represents a higher power level and allows for more advanced machinery and faster processing times.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests6.description1: Voltage and EU: Voltage tiers are measured in units of Electric Units (EU). For example, the LV tier might be up to 32 EU/t, MV up to 128 EU/t, and so on, with each tier generally quadrupling the maximum EU of the previous tier, while doubling the processing speed.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests6.description2: Machine Compatibility: Machines are designed to operate within specific voltage tiers. If a machine receives power above its rated tier, it will explode, emphasizing the importance of matching your power generation and distribution to your machines' requirements.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests6.description3: Transformers: Transformers are crucial components in GregTech that adapt power between different voltage tiers. They can step down higher voltages to lower ones for safer use by lower-tier machines or step up lower voltages for transmission over long distances or for powering higher-tier machines.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests6.description4: Cabling and Loss: Different tiers require different types of cables to handle the power without significant loss. Higher voltage tiers can transmit power more efficiently over long distances, reducing the energy lost as heat in the cables. Each voltage tier has a Superconductor, which has a loss of 0 per block. They are normally expensive but worth it. The loss per block can be seen in the tooltip for the Wire/Cable.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests6.subtitle: Don't blow up your machines!
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests6.tasks0.title: Voltage
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests6.title: EU Basics
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests7.description0: Each Cable/Wire has an amp rating. This determines how many channels of energy your Cable/Wire can carry. If you want to power 4 machines you will need 4 amps. A single LV Steam Turbine will generate 1 amp of energy at 32 EU/t.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests7.description1: A 4x Battery Buffer with 4 filled Batteries will produce 4 amps when taking energy from the Batteries, 1 amp for each battery. This means you can have 1 Steam Turbine (or up to 4) filling a 4x Battery Buffer and then the Batteries will power your machines.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests7.description2: Always make sure you match the amperage you are sending with the proper Cables/Wires. If you send out 4 amps of energy on a 1 amp Cable/Wire, it will burn the Cable/Wire. A 4x Battery Buffer (sending out 4 amps) will require at least a 4 amp Cable/Wire.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests7.subtitle: Electrical channels!
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests7.tasks0.title: Amps
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests8.description0: GregTech and Applied Energistics 2 play very well together. While you start with a basic AE2 setup, the rest of the mod basically opens up in the LV age, so as soon as you start generating EU you will be able to dive right into the rest of AE2.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests8.description1: AE2 handles items and fluids quite well in a variety of ways, it is highly advised to use AE2 for as much of your logistical needs as well as storage. While using other logistical methods like Pipes or Conduits are nice in certain situations, the bulk of your transfering could be done by AE2.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests8.description2: Channels have been set to infinite, meaning there is no channel limit for AE2 Cables.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests8.description3: There is a quest chapter containing a basic autocrafting setup but if you require more information on the mod you can see an in game guide on certain items by hovering over it with your mouse and holding [G]. There is also a quite detailed guide on AE2 in the modpack's discord.
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests8.subtitle: Applied Energistics 2
sg.new_to_gregtech.quests8.tasks0.title: AE2
sg.new_to_gregtech.title: New to GregTech

sg.progression.quests28.description0: Machine Hulls are used to build machines. There is almost always exactly 1 Machine Hull in a recipe for any single block machine, even some multiblocks use them in their patterns.
sg.progression.quests28.description1: Each tier has its own Machine Hull, with Steam acting slightly differently, using Bronze Brick Casings for Low Pressure or Steel Brick Casings for High Pressure.
sg.progression.quests28.description2: The ULV Age isn't really a thing, there are some multiblock parts that are ULV but that's about it. This is mostly so you can run some multiblocks at very low EU rating. There are very few ULV single block machines.
sg.progression.quests28.subtitle: Machines!
sg.progression.quests28.tasks0.title: Machine Hulls
sg.progression.quests29.description0: Multiblock Coil Blocks are used in a few multiblocks but most importantly the Electronic Blast Furnace (EBF). In any case where a multiblock has Coils in the pattern, you can increase the tier of Coils for an increased effect.
sg.progression.quests29.description1: When used in the EBF, they will increase the maximum heat that the EBF can produce. This will allow for higher tiered Hot Ingots to be produced.
sg.progression.quests29.description2: Increasing the tier of Coils you are using on your EBF should always be a priority.
sg.progression.quests29.description3: They are always crafted in an Assembler of their same tier.
sg.progression.quests29.subtitle: Multiblock upgrades!
sg.progression.quests29.tasks0.title: Coils
sg.progression.quests29.title: Multiblock Coil Blocks
sg.progression.quests30.description0: Voltage Coils are used in basically every Energy Hatch and Dynamo Hatch. They are ususally not the easiest thing to craft and are crucial for progressing with certain multiblocks, and most importantly increasing energy tiers.
sg.progression.quests30.description1: They are always crafted in an Assembler of their same tier.
sg.progression.quests30.subtitle: EU!
sg.progression.quests30.tasks0.title: Energy Coils
sg.progression.quests30.title: Voltage Coils
sg.progression.quests31.description0: This quest chapter shows the general overall progression.
sg.progression.quests31.description1: Refer to this if you start getting lost and don't know what to work towards.
sg.progression.quests31.description2: The quest chapters have quite a bit, but are incomplete, this should always point you in the right direction at least.
sg.progression.quests31.subtitle: What next?
sg.progression.quests31.tasks0.title: Progression
