sg.progression.quests60.description0: Circuits generally upgrade into other Circuits, but not forever. This chart shows which Circuits will upgrade into other Circuits, and which tiers the Circuits are.
sg.progression.quests60.description1: As Circuits are used for everything throughout the mod, this should be helpful to visualize certain Circuit paths.
sg.progression.quests60.description2: Each vertical line separates the different tiers. Each Circuit in the same tier can usually be used for anything Circuit related, except upgrading Circuits, that usually requires a specific Circuit type.
sg.progression.quests60.description3: More advanced Circuits of the same tier (as in the third LV Circuit) are usually much easier to craft, but not available right away.
sg.progression.quests60.description4: Things are slightly more open in the first few ages but once you get to the HV age Circuit paths become a bit more standardized.
sg.progression.quests60.description5: Fully automating a Circuit from start to finish will really help you out in the long run.
sg.progression.quests60.subtitle: Top to bottom, left to right!
sg.progression.quests60.tasks0.title: Circuits
sg.progression.quests61.description0: That's about 2.5 million days, which is almost 7000 years.
sg.progression.quests61.subtitle: \"Fill this to win Minecraft\"
sg.progression.quests62.description0: You're going to want the best Extruder you can use, not to mention that's a lot of Neutronium.
sg.progression.quests62.description1: 15 billion EU is not a small amount, make sure you don't run out of energy during the craft or it will restart!
sg.progression.quests62.description2: Hang it above your Bed, you did well.
sg.progression.quests62.subtitle: It's official!
sg.progression.title: Progression
sg.random_things.quests0.description0: An upgradable Backpack to store all your stuff and things.
sg.random_things.quests0.subtitle: Upgradable!
sg.random_things.quests1.description0: The default experience cost has been removed to allow you to easily teleport between areas of your base.
sg.random_things.quests1.description1: Sneak right click with an empty hand to rename a Waystone.
sg.random_things.quests1.description2: The Warp Stone used in the recipe allows you to teleport to a Waystone from anywhere.
sg.random_things.quests1.subtitle: No experience cost!
sg.random_things.quests2.description0: A place to store all your garbage, or useful things, you decide.
sg.random_things.quests2.description1: Play around with the settings and you can make it automatically pickup items that it already contains while voiding any extras if it fills up.
sg.random_things.quests2.description2: Very upgradable to an absolutely massive storage capacity.
sg.random_things.quests2.description3: Check and set your keybinds as you can change the mode from Bag to Construction, Bag mode is essentially a backpack while Construction mode allows you to use the item you have selected, Shears, Redstone, blocks, Cables, really anything that has a use option.
sg.random_things.quests2.description4: Press [CTRL] while hovering over a slot to lock that slot, making it so only that item is allowed in that slot, even if you run out of the item.
sg.random_things.quests2.description5: You can set Danks to the same frequency so they can share contents by typing the frequency in to the left of the \"Save the new frequency\" button. There is a somewhat hidden text input field.
sg.random_things.quests2.description6: If set in a Dock, it can be used as an external storage device (like a Chest), Hooking up a Dank in a Dock to your AE2 system with a Storage Bus will basically allow for a drawer system within the Docked Dank.
sg.random_things.quests2.subtitle: Too many things?
sg.random_things.quests3.description1: Right click while holding it to turn it on.
sg.random_things.quests3.description2: Sneak right click while holding it to set filters.
sg.random_things.quests3.subtitle: To me!
sg.random_things.quests4.description0: Can charge items with FE instead of EU, you will need an Energy Converter to convert EU to FE.
sg.random_things.quests4.subtitle: FE energy!
sg.random_things.quests5.description0: Very helpful tools to help with building. Play around with them and see what they can do. The names are pretty self explanitory.
sg.random_things.quests5.description1: Must be charged in the Charging Station with FE energy.
sg.random_things.quests5.subtitle: Easy building!
sg.random_things.quests5.title: Building Gadgets
sg.random_things.quests6.description0: Very helpful tools to help with building. Play around (carefully) with them and see what they can do. The names are pretty self explanitory.
sg.random_things.quests6.description1: Must be charged in the Charging Station with FE energy.
sg.random_things.quests6.subtitle: VOIDS BLOCKS!
sg.random_things.quests6.title: Dangerous Building Gadgets
sg.random_things.quests7.description0: Sneak right click to travel in that direction.
sg.random_things.quests7.description2: Look at a Travel Anchor and use to warp to that Travel Anchor.
sg.random_things.quests7.subtitle: Zshwoop!
sg.random_things.quests8.description0: Used to travel to with a Travel Staff.
sg.random_things.quests8.description1: If you place 1 in the world and look at it while holding a Travel Staff you can right click to teleport to the Travel Anchor.
sg.random_things.quests8.description2: Can be renamed so you see the name while looking at it from a distance.
sg.random_things.quests8.description3: Can teleport to up to 64 blocks away.
sg.random_things.quests8.subtitle: Up to 64 blocks!
sg.random_things.quests9.description0: Will place invisible lights in a 16 block radius.
sg.random_things.quests9.description1: Removing the Feral Flare Lantern will cause the lights to slowly disappear.
sg.random_things.quests9.description2: You can use a Frozen Pearl to remove the lights as well.
sg.random_things.quests9.subtitle: Light up a chunk!
sg.random_things.quests10.description0: Prevents natural passive mobs from spawning in a 64 block radius.
sg.random_things.quests10.subtitle: No passive mobs!
sg.random_things.quests11.description0: Prevents natural hostile mobs from spawning in a 64 block radius.
sg.random_things.quests11.subtitle: No hostile mobs!
sg.random_things.quests12.description0: Set a channel by sneak right clicking dyes on the white strips, anything sharing the same channel will share the same contents.
sg.random_things.quests12.subtitle: Easy fluid transfer!
sg.random_things.quests13.description0: Set a channel by sneak right clicking dyes on the white strips, anything sharing the same channel will share the same contents.
sg.random_things.quests13.subtitle: Easy item transfer!
sg.random_things.quests14.description0: Place under certain blocks to generate that block type as an item in its internal inventory.
sg.random_things.quests14.description1: Blocks that can be made infinite are tagged with the block tag \"infinite_blocks:infinite_blocks\". You can search EMI for \"#infinite_blocks\" and see the blocks available.
sg.random_things.quests14.description9: Tip: You can easily obtain Clay Dust and Concrete Dust with this.
sg.random_things.quests14.subtitle: Free building blocks!
sg.random_things.quests15.description0: Stops the visual effect of rain and snow in quite a large area.
sg.random_things.quests15.subtitle: Goodbye rain!
sg.random_things.quests16.description0: Set a channel in the GUI, anything sharing the same channel will share the same contents.
sg.random_things.quests16.subtitle: Easy fluid transfer!
sg.random_things.quests17.description0: Set a channel in the GUI, anything sharing the same channel will share the same contents.
sg.random_things.quests17.subtitle: Easy item transfer!
sg.random_things.quests18.description0: Below you will find a collection of random items and blocks to help with various tasks.
sg.random_things.quests18.subtitle: Stuff \& things!
sg.random_things.quests18.tasks0.title: Useful Things
sg.random_things.quests18.title: Useful Items \& Blocks
sg.random_things.quests19.description0: Tired of eating food? I was so I made this! Simply slap a Baked Potato on a Stick and make sure it's super secured and you're good to go!
sg.random_things.quests19.description1: Just hold it in your hand and it will keep your hunger topped up, kind of like the Healing Axe from Extra Utilities.
sg.random_things.quests19.description2: If you need a Potato you can buy one from the Market block.
sg.random_things.quests19.description3: It also happens to do the same damage as an Iron Sword and doesn't use durability. Keep those Phantoms away.
sg.random_things.quests19.subtitle: Hold me!
sg.random_things.quests20.description0: Right click on block while holding an item with durability to make the item Unbreakable.
sg.random_things.quests20.description2: Netherite Scraps can be crafted in the LV age, but if you are lucky enough Ancient Debris can also be obtained from the Random Ore Generator (Placement).
sg.random_things.quests20.subtitle: Make things Unbreakable!
sg.random_things.quests21.description0: Feed it FE and it will wirelessly charge blocks that accept FE in a 5x5x5 area at a rate of 50 FE/t.
sg.random_things.quests21.description1: Has an advanced version with better stats.
sg.random_things.quests21.subtitle: Wirelessly charge blocks with FE!
sg.random_things.quests22.description0: Feed it FE and it will wirelessly charge items in your inventory that accept FE in a 5x5x5 area at a rate of 50 FE/t.
sg.random_things.quests22.description1: Has an advanced version with better stats.
sg.random_things.quests22.subtitle: Wirelessly charge your Wireless Crafting Terminal!
sg.random_things.quests23.description0: First of all, check and set your keybinds.
sg.random_things.quests23.description1: Can be equipped in the Curio Belt slot or in its own special slot.
sg.random_things.quests23.description2: Useful for quickly swapping between tools and items.
sg.random_things.quests23.description3: Apply Belt Pouches in an Anvil to increase the storage amount. Up to 7 Belt Pouches can be installed for a maximum of 9 items.
sg.random_things.quests23.subtitle: A nice spot for tools!
sg.random_things.quests24.description0: A Hopper made for fluids with some added features.
sg.random_things.quests24.description1: Will work as a normal Hopper would but for fluids instead of items.
sg.random_things.quests24.description2: Can also take fluid blocks placed in the world above it and send it through the Flopper.
sg.random_things.quests24.description3: Can also place fluid blocks in the world where it is aiming.
sg.random_things.quests24.subtitle: Fluid Hopper!
sg.random_things.quests25.description0: Creates a 13x13x13 pocket room inside another dimension that you can access.
sg.random_things.quests25.description1: You can pipe things in and out of the block using the sides of the block and the Apertures inside the room. You can also use Ender/Dimensional storage blocks.
sg.random_things.quests25.description2: To enter the room right click on the Hyperbox. To leave the room right click on any Aperture inside the room.
sg.random_things.quests25.description3: For when you want an entire automation inside 1 block, to fit in the middle of another giant automation.
sg.random_things.quests25.description4: As long as the chunk that the Hyperbox in is loaded, the room inside will be loaded. If you pick the Hyperbox up the room will become unloaded and will reload when you place the Hyperbox down again. The Hyperbox is safe to move but just know everything inside will stop.
sg.random_things.quests25.subtitle: Pocket dimension!
sg.random_things.quests26.description1: 2 armor pieces: Speed I + Strength I
sg.random_things.quests26.description2: 3 armor pieces: Speed I + Strength II
sg.random_things.quests26.description3: 4 armor pieces: Speed I + Strength II + Resistance I
sg.random_things.quests26.description4: Wear all 4 or mix and match with other sets!
sg.random_things.quests26.subtitle: Grants potion effects!
sg.random_things.quests26.title: Atlas Exosuit
sg.random_things.quests27.description1: 2 armor pieces: Strength I + Haste I
sg.random_things.quests27.description2: 3 armor pieces: Strength II + Haste II
sg.random_things.quests27.description4: Wear all 4 or mix and match with other sets!
sg.random_things.quests27.subtitle: Grants potion effects!
sg.random_things.quests27.title: Legion Exosuit
sg.random_things.quests28.description1: 2 armor pieces: Haste I + Speed I
sg.random_things.quests28.description2: 3 armor pieces: Haste II + Speed II
sg.random_things.quests28.description3: 4 armor pieces: Haste II + Speed II + Jump Boost I
sg.random_things.quests28.description4: Wear all 4 or mix and match with other sets!
sg.random_things.quests28.subtitle: Grants potion effects!
sg.random_things.quests28.title: Stryder Exosuit
sg.random_things.quests29.description1: 2 armor pieces: Resistance I + Strength I
sg.random_things.quests29.description2: 3 armor pieces: Resistance II + Strength II
sg.random_things.quests29.description3: 4 armor pieces: Resistance III + Strength II
sg.random_things.quests29.description4: Wear all 4 or mix and match with other sets!
sg.random_things.quests29.subtitle: Grants potion effects!
sg.random_things.quests29.title: Ogre Exosuit
sg.random_things.quests30.description1: 2 armor pieces: Haste I + Fire Resistance I
sg.random_things.quests30.description2: 3 armor pieces: Haste II + Fire Resistance I
sg.random_things.quests30.description3: 4 armor pieces: Haste II + Fire Resistance I + Water Breathing I
sg.random_things.quests30.description4: Wear all 4 or mix and match with other sets!
sg.random_things.quests30.subtitle: Grants potion effects!
sg.random_things.quests30.title: Ion Exosuit
sg.random_things.quests31.description0: Insert 1, 2, or 3 blocks in the Architect's Cutter and see what you can produce.
sg.random_things.quests31.subtitle: So many blocks!
sg.random_things.quests32.description0: Insert a Clay Ball, any Planks, and any Cobblestone in the Furniture Station and see what you can produce.
sg.random_things.quests32.subtitle: So much furniture!
sg.random_things.quests33.description0: Framed Blocks adds Framed Cubes, which can be crafted into various shapes and placed in the world. You can use another block on the Framed Blocks to make the Framed Block take on the texture of the block you used on it.
sg.random_things.quests33.subtitle: Too many blocks!
sg.random_things.quests34.description0: All of Ender IO's Conduits and Tanks are available but everything else from Ender IO is disabled.
sg.random_things.quests34.description1: Note that Upgrades and Filters are not available currently.
sg.random_things.quests34.subtitle: Conduits \& Tanks!
sg.random_things.quests34.title: Ender IO Conduits
sg.random_things.quests35.description0: Modular Routers offers 1 block, the Modular Router, and many different Modules, Upgrades, and Augments that can change how it operates.
sg.random_things.quests35.description1: Play around with different Modules, Upgrades, and Augments, as well as settings within the Modular Router and you can do a lot.
sg.random_things.quests35.subtitle: Modules, Upgrades, \& Augments!
sg.random_things.quests35.title: Modular Routers
sg.random_things.quests36.description0: Can craft Enchanted Books using different input materials and experience. All recipes can be seen in REI.
sg.random_things.quests36.subtitle: Craft Enchanted Books!
sg.random_things.quests37.description0: Can store experience for later use, has a self explanitory GUI.
sg.random_things.quests37.subtitle: Store experience!
sg.random_things.quests38.description0: Pulls items in the world into itself and stores them in its inventory.
sg.random_things.quests38.subtitle: Vacuums items!
sg.random_things.quests39.description0: Pulls experience in the world into itself and stores it as a fluid.
sg.random_things.quests39.subtitle: Vacuums experience!
sg.random_things.quests40.description0: Can move tile entities like Chests, Spawners, machines, and more.
sg.random_things.quests40.description1: Sneak right click to place the Box on something.
sg.random_things.quests40.description2: Left click to take the Box off, or sneak right click to pick up the Box.
sg.random_things.quests40.description3: Right click with the Box containing something to place it down.
sg.random_things.quests40.subtitle: Move Chests, Spawners, machines \& more!
sg.random_things.quests41.description0: Can be used to capture a mob. Use again to release the mob.
sg.random_things.quests41.subtitle: Mob transfer!
sg.random_things.quests42.description0: Shrink yourself down to 20%% of your normal size, or grow to 10 times your normal size. Requires FE to operate.
sg.random_things.quests42.description1: You can also do the same to mobs by left clicking on them with the Personal Shrinking Device. A shrunken mob can be captured with a Glass Bottle.
sg.random_things.quests42.description2: Right click to open the GUI and select the size you want. Sneak right click to activate.
sg.random_things.quests43.description0: Wireless item, fluid, and FE transfer. Set 2 to the same channel and they will be linked together.
sg.random_things.quests43.description1: You can change the send and receive settings in the GUI.
sg.random_things.quests43.subtitle: Wireless items, fluids, \& FE!
sg.random_things.quests44.description0: Sneak right click on the block to wish to link with the Entangled Binder, then right click on the Entangled Block with the Entangled Binder to link the blocks together.
sg.random_things.quests44.description1: This will allow you to interact with the Entangled Block as if it were the linked block.
sg.random_things.quests44.subtitle: Wireless items, fluids, \& FE!
sg.random_things.quests45.description0: Wandering Traders within 6 chunks of this block will be redirected to this position.
sg.random_things.quests45.description1: Send him into a mob farm, push him into the void, drop him 200 blocks onto Iron Spikes, get creative!
sg.random_things.quests45.subtitle: NoMoWanderer!
sg.random_things.title: Random Things
sg.steam_age.quests0.description0: Accepts solid fuels and Water to create Steam. If no Water is present and they are heated up they will explode.
sg.steam_age.quests0.description1: Note that fuels last much longer than in a normal Furnace. A single piece of Coke will burn for 32 minutes.
sg.steam_age.quests0.description2: Advised you craft at least 2 of these.
sg.steam_age.quests0.subtitle: Produces 6 L/t!
sg.steam_age.quests1.description0: While you don't need Wrought Iron Tools, you may want to use them. They have more durability than Iron Tools.
sg.steam_age.quests1.description1: AE2 can handle tools with any durability for crafting \"just fine\".
sg.steam_age.quests1.description2: Most tools need plates which makes crafting Diamond Tools a little gated behind a Cutter, except a Diamond Hammer, that just requires normal Diamonds.
sg.steam_age.quests1.description3: While some tools do have additional features not listed here, these are the main features.
sg.steam_age.quests1.description4: Hammer - Can be used to mute a machine. Harvesting a block in the world will act as if it was run through a Forge Hammer. This allows GT Hammers to be used for obtaining Gravel, Sand, and Dust as well.
sg.steam_age.quests1.description5: Wrench - Can be used to connect or disconnect Pipes, set output sides for machines, and rotate machines.
sg.steam_age.quests1.description6: Wire Cutter - Can be used to connect or disconnect Wires/Cables.
sg.steam_age.quests1.description7: Screwdriver - Can be used to edit Covers and various blocks like Drums.
sg.steam_age.quests1.description8: Crowbar - Can be used to remove Covers from machines.
sg.steam_age.quests1.description9: &6Any item with durability can be made Unbreakable by using it on a Block of Netherite, this will consume the Block of Netherite.&r
sg.steam_age.quests1.subtitle: Wrought Iron!
sg.steam_age.quests1.tasks0.title: Any #forge:tools/hammers
sg.steam_age.quests1.tasks1.title: Any #forge:tools/files
sg.steam_age.quests1.tasks2.title: Any #forge:tools/saws
sg.steam_age.quests1.tasks3.title: Any #forge:tools/mortars
sg.steam_age.quests1.tasks4.title: Any #forge:tools/knives
sg.steam_age.quests1.tasks5.title: Any #forge:tools/wrenches
sg.steam_age.quests1.tasks6.title: Any #forge:tools/screwdrivers
sg.steam_age.quests1.tasks7.title: Any #forge:tools/wire_cutters
sg.steam_age.quests1.tasks8.title: Any #forge:tools/crowbars
sg.steam_age.quests1.title: Basic Tools
sg.steam_age.quests2.description0: To make a Water Pump for your Steam Boilers you will first need Creosote Oil to make Treated Wood.
sg.steam_age.quests2.description1: The 3 Coke Oven Hatches are optional and allow automation, however if you don't use those then you need 3 more Coke Oven Bricks.
sg.steam_age.quests2.description2: Make sure to build all multiblocks within a single chunk, do not let a multiblock machine cross over chunk borders. Pres F3+G to see chunk borders.
sg.steam_age.quests2.description3: For a visual representation of all multiblock setups check the uses of a multiblock part in EMI and there is a page for Multiblock Info which displays a visual guide.
sg.steam_age.quests2.description4: 1 Hopper Botany Pot can easily be enough to automate a Coke Oven.
sg.steam_age.quests2.subtitle: Making Creosote Oil!
sg.steam_age.quests3.description0: Slowly generates Water, does not actually need a source of Water.
sg.steam_age.quests3.description1: Use Pipes to move the Water where you need.
sg.steam_age.quests3.description2: You can upgrade the Output Hatch to increase the amount of Water produced.
sg.steam_age.quests3.subtitle: Making Water!
sg.steam_age.quests4.description0: If somehow you need more, random saplings and Plant Fiber are obtained by harvesting Dirt with a Crushing Hammer.
sg.steam_age.quests4.description1: Harvesting a Rubber Tree will also grant Sticky Resin.
sg.steam_age.quests4.description2: You can grow them in a Botany Pot as well.
sg.steam_age.quests4.description3: For some reason you get more planks from Rubber Logs than other logs.
sg.steam_age.quests4.subtitle: More efficient planks?
sg.steam_age.quests5.description0: Will be needed in large quantities when making circuits.
sg.steam_age.quests5.description1: While you can extract Sticky Resin from other parts of a Rubber Tree, Sticky Resin gives 3 compared to 1.
sg.steam_age.quests5.description2: Note you can get Sticky Resin from a Botany Pot as well but harvesting Rubber Trees in world is significantly faster. If you need a lot fast then just Ultimine a bunch of Rubber Trees.
sg.steam_age.quests5.subtitle: From Rubber Trees!
sg.steam_age.quests6.description0: While some basic alloys like Bronze can be made by hand, some more advanced alloys like Red Alloy Ingots require an Alloy Smelter.
sg.steam_age.quests6.description1: All steam machines require an output side which can be set with a Wrench. The output side allows steam buildup to escape. If there is no output side for steam buildup to escape the machine will stop working. Do not block the output side.
sg.steam_age.quests6.description2: If your machine made 1 recipe then stopped, this is why.
sg.steam_age.quests6.description3: Below is an image of an automated Alloy Smelter, crafting Red Alloy Ingots. You can use a Robot Arm on the Redstone side to supply an exact amount into the Alloy Smelter so it doesn't overfill with 1 material. A Conveyer will be good enough for the Copper side as it is slower than the Redstone.
sg.steam_age.quests6.subtitle: More alloys!
sg.steam_age.quests7.description0: Nuggets to Ingots and Ingots to Blocks cannot be crafted by hand, you need to compress them.
sg.steam_age.quests7.description1: Also required for things like compressing Fireclay Dust into Compressed Fireclay.
sg.steam_age.quests7.subtitle: Ingots to Blocks \& more!
sg.steam_age.quests8.description0: While it can do other things, most notably you can make Plates at a 3:2 ratio, still better than a Hammer.
sg.steam_age.quests8.subtitle: Slightly more efficient Plates!
sg.steam_age.quests9.description0: Something to note on Circuits, everything revolves around Circuits and they typically evolve into higher tier Circuits. Each Circuit type usually evolves 3 times with some exceptions near the start and end. Every machine you make will require at least 1 Circuit and sometimes up to 4. When crafting Circuits always mass craft as much as you can. Having stacks of Circuits will always be helpful. Each age has their own tier of Circuits and usually grants access to crafting earlier tiers of Circuits easier.
sg.steam_age.quests9.description1: Each machine needs on average 2, and the next tier of Circuits requires 3 of this tier Circuit. You will want to automate as much of this as possible.
sg.steam_age.quests9.description2: Keep in mind certain resources will become significantly easier to process and obtain once you reach the LV age, like Wires in a Wiremill. You may want to make as few of these as possible until you get some new machinery and a basic energy setup.
sg.steam_age.quests9.description3: Keep in mind resources are infinite and every single step of the process can be 100%% automated if you wish.
sg.steam_age.quests9.description4: See the Progression quest page for a visual diagram of how Circuits evolve.
sg.steam_age.quests9.subtitle: LV Circuits!
sg.steam_age.quests10.description0: Firebricks are no quick task, and you need a lot of them. Steel Ingots can also be made in the Electric Blast Furnace in the LV age.
sg.steam_age.quests10.subtitle: Steel!
sg.steam_age.quests11.description0: Crushes many different items into dusts.
sg.steam_age.quests11.description1: Note that Macerators do not give byproducts unless using an HV Macerator or higher. Each tier above HV will increase the chances of getting a byproduct.
sg.steam_age.quests11.subtitle: Dusts!
sg.steam_age.quests12.description0: Grow your crops and trees automatically with a Hopper Botany Pot. Ideal for most resources.
sg.steam_age.quests12.description1: You can use the rewards to automate your Coke Oven, or whatever you want but you probably don't quite have access to Rubber yet.
sg.steam_age.quests12.subtitle: Crops \& trees!
sg.steam_age.quests12.tasks0.title: Hopper Botany Pots
sg.steam_age.quests12.title: Hopper Botany Pot
sg.steam_age.quests13.description0: Your first Glass will be in an Alloy Smelter with Glass Dust and a Casting Mold (Block), Casting Molds are not consumed.
sg.steam_age.quests13.subtitle: Steel before Glass?
sg.steam_age.quests14.description0: There are a few combinations you can use to make Steel Ingots at first but Wrought Iron Ingots and Coke is the fastest.
sg.steam_age.quests14.description1: Note that using the Market block you can buy Spawn Eggs of almost every mob using Steel Ingots as payment.
sg.steam_age.quests14.description2: Steel is going to be used for basically everything throughout the LV age, just like Bronze was used for basically everything in the Steam age. This will be a pattern going forward for each age.
sg.steam_age.quests14.subtitle: LV material!
sg.steam_age.quests15.description0: This is technically the final piece of the puzzle for your first Circuit. You now have everything you require to craft them.
sg.steam_age.quests15.description1: A large amount of Rubber Sheets will be required for Cables. Look into automating Liquid Rubber in the LV age.
sg.steam_age.quests15.subtitle: Here we go!
sg.steam_age.quests16.description0: You have access to Raw Sulfur without needing The Nether.
sg.steam_age.quests16.description1: Required for creating Rubber Ingots in an Alloy Smelter.
sg.steam_age.quests16.subtitle: No Nether required!
sg.steam_age.quests17.description0: While this machine has over 400 recipes, we will just focus on 1, Raw Rubber Pulp.
sg.steam_age.quests17.description1: Raw Rubber Pulp comes from basically every part of a Rubber Tree, however Sticky Resin gives the most.
sg.steam_age.quests17.description2: You can easily automate Sticky Resin in a Hopper Botany Pot, it has a 65%% chance to produce a Sticky Resin when growing.
sg.steam_age.quests17.subtitle: Extract all the things!
sg.steam_age.quests18.description0: Will generate whatever ore is above it at a rate of 1 per second and place it in its inventory.
sg.steam_age.quests18.description1: Advised to set one of these up for each ore you require, simulating a never ending automated ore vein of that type.
sg.steam_age.quests18.description2: You can use a combination of blocks from the Simple Resource Generators mod to get an ore where you need it to be.
sg.steam_age.quests18.description3: Keep in mind Nether and End Ores smelt into 2 ingots.
sg.steam_age.quests18.description4: If you want the raw ores instead of ores, look into a Block Breaker when you can.
sg.steam_age.quests18.description5: Before trying to progress too much you should try to get at least a few of these crafted.
sg.steam_age.quests18.subtitle: No more mining!
sg.steam_age.quests19.description0: The first form of portable fluid storage available.
sg.steam_age.quests19.description1: Drums cannot be inserted into from the bottom, but they can be configured with a Screwdriver to auto export from the bottom.
sg.steam_age.quests19.description2: You can insert or extract fluids from a machine by trying to place a Drum that contains fluids in the fluid input slot, or trying to place a Drum with space in it in a fluid ouput slot that contains a fluid.
sg.steam_age.quests19.subtitle: Basic fluid storage!
sg.steam_age.quests20.description0: The second form of portable fluid storage available.
sg.steam_age.quests20.description1: Comes in all of the standard progression materials like Bronze, Steel, Aluminium, and so on.
sg.steam_age.quests20.description2: Advised to always have the largest Steam buffer possible.
sg.steam_age.quests20.description3: Drums cannot be inserted into from the bottom, but they can be configured with a Screwdriver to auto export from the bottom.
sg.steam_age.quests20.subtitle: More Steam!
sg.steam_age.quests21.description0: The third form of portable fluid storage available.
sg.steam_age.quests21.description1: Advised to always have the largest Steam buffer possible.
sg.steam_age.quests21.description2: Drums cannot be inserted into from the bottom, but they can be configured with a Screwdriver to auto export from the bottom.
sg.steam_age.quests21.subtitle: MORE STEAM!
sg.steam_age.quests22.description0: An upgraded Steam Boiler, produces slightly more than double the standard Low Pressure Steam Solid Boiler.
sg.steam_age.quests22.description1: A single piece of Coke will burn for 16 minutes.
sg.steam_age.quests22.subtitle: Produces 15 L/t!
sg.steam_age.quests23.description0: Buy most seeds, saplings, crops, and even Spawn Eggs.
sg.steam_age.quests23.description1: You can turn Redstone Dust into Red Dye if needed for the recipe.
sg.steam_age.quests23.subtitle: Buy things!
sg.steam_age.quests24.description0: See the Multiblock Info tab by checking the uses for the Large Bronze Boiler in REI for exact number of blocks and setup as it can be slightly modular depending what fuel source you use (solid or liquid).
sg.steam_age.quests24.description1: You can either use solid or liquid fuels, hence the 2 optional quests for the Hatches. Both are viable but personally I like to feed it with Lava.
sg.steam_age.quests24.description2: Fuel is consumed VERY quickly to produce up to 800 mb/t of Steam. You need a very good fuel production in order to properly run this multiblock boiler.
sg.steam_age.quests24.description3: 6 Iron Lava Furnaces is just enough to keep up with the fuel consumption rate. If you are having problems with fuel consumption, try turning the Throttle down to 25%% when starting the Boiler, then turn it back up to 100%%.
sg.steam_age.quests24.description4: 1 Water Source Tier 1 is more than enough to keep up with the Water comsumption rate.
sg.steam_age.quests24.description5: &6&nDO NOT provide fuel without Water or it will explode.&r
sg.steam_age.quests24.description6: There are higher tier multiblock boilers available that produce more Steam.
sg.steam_age.quests24.description7: As this is probably 1 of your first muiltiblocks with a Maintenance Hatch, you should know about them. When you first place down a Maintenance Hatch it will need to be \"maintained\" with certain tools. Open the Maintenance Hatch and hover over the icon to the top right to see the issues. Left click in the main slot in the interface with the correct tools in your inventory to \"maintain\" the Maintentance Hatch. This needs to be done the first time you place down the Maintenance Hatch and again many hours down the road. I went about 600 Minecraft days until I needed to maintain my Boiler again. If a multiblock requires maintenance then it will stop working.
sg.steam_age.quests24.description8: If this is your first multiblock in general, you may want to check out the Multiblocks quest in the LV chapter.
sg.steam_age.quests24.subtitle: So much Steam!
sg.steam_age.quests25.description0: A pretty basic multiblock that runs off Steam and smelts 8 things at once.
sg.steam_age.quests25.subtitle: Smelts 8 at once!
sg.steam_age.quests26.description0: Use your AE2 system for more than just storage and autocrafting. You have more than enough space to be able to use your system as a piping method as well.
sg.steam_age.quests26.description1: Your AE2 system can store Steam as a fluid, use Import/Export Busses to move Steam around your base efficiently.
sg.steam_age.quests26.description2: This goes for all fluids, GregTech is very heavy on the use of different fluids and they can be tricky to handle sometimes.
sg.steam_age.quests26.description3: See the AE2 quest chapter for some information on basic autocrafting.
sg.steam_age.quests26.description4: Hold [G] while hovering over an item to pull up an in game guide.
sg.steam_age.quests26.subtitle: Can be used as piping!
sg.steam_age.quests26.tasks0.title: AE2
sg.steam_age.quests27.description0: GregTech pipes can be quite good in certain situations, in other situations you may want to go for AE2, Modular Routers, EnderIO, or LaserIO, or even Ender Tanks/Chests or Dimensional Tanks/Chests.
sg.steam_age.quests27.description1: The Covers can make GregTech Pipes quite powerful but the pipes in general are known to be a bit buggy from time to time.
sg.steam_age.quests27.description2: &6*GregTech auto extraction methods can be buggy at times, mixing some logistics mods together may be required for certain tasks.*&r
sg.steam_age.quests27.subtitle: More than just GregTech!
sg.steam_age.quests27.tasks0.title: GregTech Pipes
sg.steam_age.quests27.title: Logistics
sg.steam_age.quests28.description0: Before electricity you will require Steam power. Each Steam powered machine has a small internal buffer for Steam but it is advised to have a large Steam buffer.
sg.steam_age.quests28.description1: Steam machines require a Steam exhaust port to be set using a Wrench. This will allow a small amount of pressured Steam to escape into the world after each craft. You cannot block the exhaust port or the Steam cannot escape, making the machine stop. Standing in the escaping Steam will also damage you. If your machine did 1 recipe then stopped, this is why.
sg.steam_age.quests28.description2: Steam can be transfered using any fluid transfer method. If using GregTech Pipes, make sure they can handle Gasses and have the proper heat rating.
sg.steam_age.quests28.description3: Never provide fuel to a Steam Boiler of any kind without having Water present or the Boiler will explode. What causes the explosion is when the Boiler is heated up without Water, and then receives Water. &6&n&lWhen a Boiler is hot and has no Water, it will explode when receiving Water.&r&r&r Always make sure Water is present. This being said, they do not actually consume too much Water.
sg.steam_age.quests28.description4: When talking about Steam amounts, 1 L = 1mb, so 1000 L of Steam is 1 Bucket.
sg.steam_age.quests28.description5: Steam can leak out of an open Pipe connection, make sure your Pipe lines are all closed.
sg.steam_age.quests28.subtitle: Bronze!
sg.steam_age.quests28.tasks0.title: Steam Age
sg.steam_age.quests29.description0: Works the same as a Low Pressure Steam Solid Boiler, but uses sunlight instead of solid fuel.
sg.steam_age.quests29.subtitle: 6 L/t!
sg.steam_age.quests30.description0: Better than the Solid Boilers but not quite as good as the Liquid Boilers.
sg.steam_age.quests30.subtitle: 18 L/t!
sg.steam_age.quests31.description0: Most multiblocks can share the walls, floors, and ceiling.
sg.steam_age.quests31.description1: In this picture all 4 Coke Ovens are sharing blocks with each other. The ceiling of the bottom level is the floor of the top level and the middle walls are all shared. The center block in this picture is actually being shared by all 4 multiblocks.
sg.steam_age.quests31.description2: Hatches and busses can often be shared as well, allowing for much more compact designs and automation.
sg.steam_age.quests31.subtitle: Save materials!
sg.steam_age.quests31.tasks0.title: Sharing Walls
sg.steam_age.quests31.title: Sharing Multiblock Walls
sg.steam_age.quests32.description0: Can be used as a Cover to regulate how many items can be inserted/extracted at a time or in general. Can be used to always keep a certain amount of items in a machine, to not overfill a machine with 1 type of item.
sg.steam_age.quests32.subtitle: Supply exact amounts!
sg.steam_age.quests33.description0: Early Bronze can be crafted by hand with Copper Dust and Tin Dust, which can be obtained by crafting Ingots with a Mortar.
sg.steam_age.quests33.subtitle: Mortar + Ingots!
sg.steam_age.quests33.title: Bronze Dust
sg.steam_age.title: Steam Age
sg.uhv_age.quests0.subtitle: Neutronium!
sg.uhv_age.quests0.tasks0.title: UHV Age
sg.uhv_age.quests1.description0: That's about 2.5 million days, which is almost 7000 years.
sg.uhv_age.quests1.subtitle: \"Fill this to win Minecraft.\"
sg.uhv_age.quests2.description0: For now, make a stack of Dragon Eggs, I'll make a better \"you win\" item when I think of one.
sg.uhv_age.title: UHV Age
sg.uv_age.quests0.subtitle: UHV Circuits!
sg.uv_age.quests1.description0: Just as Darmstadtium was the main material for the UV age, Neutronium is the main material for the UHV age.
sg.uv_age.quests1.subtitle: UHV material!
sg.uv_age.quests2.description0: Process Liquid Americium and Liquid Naquadria in a ZPM Fusion Reactor to produce Liquid Neutronium.
sg.uv_age.quests2.subtitle: ZPM Fusion Reactor!
sg.uv_age.quests3.description0: Process Liquid Lutetium and Liquid Chromium in a ZPM Fusion Reactor to produce Liquid Americium.
sg.uv_age.quests3.subtitle: ZPM Fusion Reactor!
sg.uv_age.quests4.description0: Process Liquid Lanthanum and Liquid Silicon in an IV Fusion Reactor to produce Liquid Lutetium.
sg.uv_age.quests4.subtitle: IV Fusion Reactor!
sg.uv_age.quests5.description0: Process Chromium in an MV Extractor to produce Liquid Chromium.
sg.uv_age.quests5.subtitle: MV Extractor!
sg.uv_age.quests6.description0: Process Lanthanum Dust in an LV Extractor to produce Liquid Lanthanum.
sg.uv_age.quests6.subtitle: LV Extractor!
sg.uv_age.quests7.description0: Process Silicon in an HV Extractor to produce Liquid Silicon.
sg.uv_age.quests7.subtitle: HV Extractor!
sg.uv_age.quests8.description0: Process Rare Earth in an LV Centrifuge to produce a Small Pile of Lanthanum Dust.
sg.uv_age.quests8.subtitle: LV Centrifuge!
sg.uv_age.quests9.description0: Process a variety of materials in a variety of machines to produce Rare Earth.
sg.uv_age.quests9.subtitle: Choices!
sg.uv_age.quests10.description0: Process Enriched Naquadah in an HV Extractor to produce Liquid Enriched Naquadah.
sg.uv_age.quests10.subtitle: HV Extractor!
sg.uv_age.quests11.description0: You should already have Radon Gas (hopefully in large quantites) from producing the Nanoprocessor Circuit line.
sg.uv_age.quests11.subtitle: You should already have this!
sg.uv_age.quests12.description0: Process Liquid Enriched Naquadah and Radon Gas in an ZPM Fusion Reactor to produce Liquid Naquadria.
sg.uv_age.quests12.subtitle: ZPM Fusion Reactor!
sg.uv_age.title: UV Age
sg.zpm_age.quests0.subtitle: UV Circuits!
sg.zpm_age.quests1.description0: Just as Naquadah Alloy was the main material for the ZPM age, Darmstadtium is the main material for the UV age.
sg.zpm_age.quests1.subtitle: UV material!
sg.zpm_age.quests2.description0: Process in a ULV Fluid Solifdifier to produce Darmstadtium Ingots.
sg.zpm_age.quests2.subtitle: Fluid Solidifer!
sg.zpm_age.quests3.description0: Process in an LuV Fusion Reactor with Arsenic Vapor to produce Liquid Darmstadtium.
sg.zpm_age.quests3.subtitle: Fusion Reactor!
sg.zpm_age.quests4.description0: Process Arsenic Dust in an LV Extractor to produce Arsenic Vapor.
sg.zpm_age.quests4.description1: Process in an LuV Fusion Reactor with Liquid Ruthenium to produce Liquid Darmstadtium.
sg.zpm_age.quests4.subtitle: Fusion Reactor!
sg.zpm_age.quests5.subtitle: Using more energy!
sg.zpm_age.quests21.description0: Process Hot Enriched Naquadah Ingots in an MV Vacuum Freezer to produce Enriched Naquadah Ingots.
sg.zpm_age.quests21.subtitle: MV Vacuum Freezer!
sg.zpm_age.title: ZPM Age
sg.ev_rewards.title: EV Rewards
sg.hv_rewards.title: HV Rewards
sg.iv_rewards.title: IV Rewards
sg.lv_rewards.title: LV Rewards
sg.mv_rewards.title: MV Rewards
sg.steam.title: Steam Rewards
